Job Title: Satellite Communications Industrial Engineer/MBA in Greenbelt, MD
Job Description:
Teltrium is a technology company that provides systems engineering services, custom software products, and project execution support and capabilities to satellite communications and spectrum management programs at NASA Centers. We’re a small company focused on nurturing an agile and innovate team that develops creative and high-quality solutions for our unique customers.

We are seeking engineers with fundamental knowledge of wireless communication systems, digital networks, or satellite communication systems to join our growing team. These positions support systems engineering, modeling and simulation, and software development activities for the following NASA Centers: Goddard Space Flight Center, Greenbelt, MD, Glen Research Center, Cleveland, OH and at NASA Headquarters, as well as the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL). Activities that each of these functional areas perform are as follows:

Systems Engineering Activities: Interface definition and management; analyses and trade studies, end-to-end network performance, RF and baseband system/subsystem evaluation; system validation and verification; deliverables review and configuration management processes.
Project Management/Business Process Analyst: Lead the collection, capture, and management of mission user needs, from prioritization, concept development, and user story writing to support development and deployment as a business analyst subject matter expert. Facilitate the gathering of enterprise service management requirements to meet the operational objectives of business needs. Identify core business needs, decompose and document concepts of operations, story maps, briefings, and user stories, document business rules, and construct workflow diagrams, as needed. Condense complex business processes into clear and actionable user stories with acceptance criteria. Work with internal and external stakeholders to review, update, and maintain a business process roadmap of the to-be system and evaluate areas of reengineering by outlining potential to-be processes.

Qualifications

Education: Bachelor of Science Industrial Engineering or MBA with Satellite Communications Experience

Experience: Minimum of 5 years of recent and relevant industrial engineering experience that included doing business case analysis (cost accounting type with labor hours). Minimum of 1 year of DoD project management or DoD contract experience. Understanding of Satellite Communications.

Work Authorization: Candidates must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident.

Role / Work Schedule

These are full-time, on-site positions in Greenbelt, MD with flexibility for occasional remote work.

Preferred Skills

Self-starter and creative problem solver.
Strong organizational skills and attention to details
Excellent verbal and written skills including articulating and presenting technical topics in a clear and concise manner to peers as well as executive level customer audiences
Familiarity with ground station/network equipment and protocols in satellite communication

Overview:
Welcome Home! Build your career with Lennar!

As one of the nation’s largest builders, Lennar has built over one million new homes for families across America. Since 1954, our communities have catered to all lifestyles and family dynamics, whether you are a first-time or move-up buyer, multi-generational family, or active adult.
At Lennar, Everything’s Included in our homes, and Everyone’s Included on our team. Our Everyone’s Included vision is to be as inclusive and diverse as the communities we build unleashing the power of diversity within our workforce to drive innovation & sustainable growth.

Division Business Analyst:

Lennar is seeking a strategic and sharp Division Business Analyst who will be responsible for analyzing reports and models, reviewing financials, and data mining to formulate and deliver fact-based pricing strategies to division leadership. This position will work closely with various department to understand factors impacting the pricing and selling process to develop and implement strategic solutions that drive key operational metrics focused on improving financial results. The Division Business Analyst must possess the intellectual curiosity to actively seek out new areas of potential improvement and drill into the details to find the root cause of a problem, which requires the willingness to question results and assumptions, and an internal drive for continuous improvement.
Responsibilities:

Manage overall pricing process including providing recommendations and obtaining approvals on home-by-home pricing and release order and communicating results across the sales organization.
Recommend price adjustments to Management based on an analysis of historical sales trends, current and future market conditions and the overall market supply and demand dynamic.
Collaborate with Division lines of business to develop a deep understanding of the process, strategies and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that influence top line Revenue growth.
Provide revenue management functional expertise and leadership to management team and market sales leaders.
Provide an objective point of view to complex business and issues based on a deep understanding of data and analytics as well as business principals.
Regularly translate data, insights, and forecasts into actionable and relevant recommendations by utilizing visualization and/or data analysis tools, presentations and other means to effectively communicate clear and concise recommendations to senior division leadership.
Track, create, maintain, and analyze data.
Develop new skills, techniques, and statistical models for predicting future operational results, costs and key performance metrics.
Consolidate, prepare, and analyze operational data to understand cause and effect relationships and identify and share root causes.
Oversee day-to-day implementation and analysis of the different initiatives.
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in related field (business, finance, etc) preferred
MBA a plus
2 years as a Revenue and/or Pricing Manager, Business analyst or comparable experience preferred
Experience in the homebuilding industry preferred
Experience with business software preferred (Salesforce, JDE, Business Intelligence)
Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)
Lennar Core Values
Our commitment to Quality, Value, and Integrity is the underlying foundation upon which Lennar was built, and these three fundamental principles still guide us in caring for our customers, associates, shareholders, and community.

Life at Lennar!
Lennar recognizes our associates are the heart of the company’s success. Learn new skills, build your path, and become an integral part of the Lennar Family.

Description

Are you passionate about analyzing complex problems integrating Space, Air, Surface and Ground warfare domains using state of the art software and computing capabilities?
Are you searching for an opportunity to apply your operations analysis background in an engaging, inquisitive environment?

If so, the Air Combat and Strike Analysis Group at the Applied Physics Lab is looking for you!

Our dedicated team of engineers, physicists, mathematicians, and computer scientists are engaged in an extensive portfolio of projects with the U.S. military. Our analysts support the acquisition, maintenance, and assessment of various military systems and technologies.
We want you to join our team, and provide your background in operations analysis to expand our capabilities and help us stay on the cutting edge of the field!
Our work is sophisticated, engaging, and frequently has significant impact to Department of Defense programs. We pride ourselves on our intellectual integrity, and our ability to deliver outstanding, unbiased analysis products. Our team emphasizes personal improvement and growth over short-lived success.
If this sounds like an environment that would help you foster and grow your interest in our domain, consider us as part of your future.

As a Multi-Domain Operations Analyst…
Your primary responsibilities will be performing analysis on interacting sensor, tracker, communication, and weapon systems for multi-domain, mission-level simulations, with the goal of discovering insightful trends, informing conclusions, and supporting decision-making.
You will perform statistical analysis to find trends, assess risk, and document uncertainties in simulation results.
You will also collaborate with experts in specific warfare domains and technologies, and learn to integrate key effects together into a multi-domain simulation environment.
You will likely join a small team including junior analysts who will benefit from your experience, and senior engineers with whom you will guide the direction of projects.
You can engage in independent research projects that encourage creative solutions and reward independent initiative.
You will have the opportunity to present your work through briefings to both technical specialists and pivotal decision makers.

Qualifications

You will meet our minimum qualification for the job if you…
Have a BS or MS degree in a technical or scientific field such as Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science
Have demonstrated excellence performing modeling, simulation, and analysis in either Air, Space, Surface or Ground warfare domain(s)
Are highly skilled in learning new and challenging topics
Are able to effectively work in a highly collaborative environment and communicate complex ideas to a variety of partners
Are proficient to fluent in a programming or scripting language such as MATLAB or Python
Are able to obtain Interim Secret level security clearance by your start date and can ultimately obtain Top Secret level clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship
You’ll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you…
Have a PhD in one of the scientific or technical fields listed above
Have knowledge and experience integrating across any combination of Air, Space, Surface, or Ground warfare domains, with an emphasis on Space domain
Have experience leading teams including managing workflow, backlog, load balancing, and support for internal/external engagements
Experience with M&S tools: AFSIM, STK, Suppressor, or Brawler
Experience working with version control software and tools (Git/GitLab) on team M&S efforts
Have an active Top Secret security clearance with current or previous Special Program Access (SAP)/SCI

Why work at APL?

The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) brings world-class expertise to our nation’s most critical defense, security, space and science challenges. While we are dedicated to solving complex challenges and pioneering new technologies, what makes us truly outstanding is our culture. We offer a vibrant, welcoming atmosphere where you can bring your authentic self to work, continue to grow, and build strong connections with inspiring teammates.

At APL, we celebrate our differences and encourage creativity and bold, new ideas. Our employees enjoy generous benefits, including a robust education assistance program, unparalleled retirement contributions, and a healthy work/life balance. APL’s campus is located in the Baltimore-Washington metro area. Learn more about our career opportunities at http://www.jhuapl.edu/careers.


About Us

APL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, occupation, marital or familial status, political opinion, personal appearance, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

APL is committed to promoting an innovative environment that embraces diversity, encourages creativity, and supports inclusion of new ideas. In doing so, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals of all abilities, including those with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in any part of the hiring process, please contact Accommodations@jhuapl.edu. Only by ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard are we empowered to be bold, do great things, and make the world a better place.

About Us

Are you a driven individual who is seeking a company that can match your desire to do more? Do you want to join an organization where you’re not just a cog in a machine, somewhere you can be yourself and make a difference in world? We may be the right fit for you!

C & A Scientific is a company with over 3 decades of experience in the medical and educational fields, and our vision is to be the leader in improving the health and minds of people worldwide. We’ve experienced a high rate of growth over the last 5 years, and have plans to achieve even more in our next 5 year period. In order to achieve these objectives, we are looking for exceptional and dedicated individuals that are willing to fully commit and to help C & A make a positive impact in medicine and learning.

Our company offers a competitive benefits package and compensation, but our biggest strength is the relationship with have with our team. The individuals who fit our culture are willing to go above and beyond to produce great results, and we do the same for them by offering things like flexibility in their work. If a team member has to take time for a personal appointment during part of the day, they are allowed to do so without using PTO. If someone has an emergency come up that requires them to travel, they are offered the ability to work remotely instead of taking leave. As long as the individual is giving their all and not letting their team down, C & A treats them as adults and offers the flexibility to handle their lives.

If this culture sounds like a good fit for you, read on!

Since 2009, we have worked closely with our clients to develop end-to-end solutions that achieve their desired business outcomes. We offer information technology strategy, enterprise architecture, solutions architecture, and program management services.

Roles and Responsibilities

This Business Analyst will work to help analyze, define, and document requirements that translate customer needs into Salesforce technology solutions that support the company’s strategic goals. Work location is in the Washington, DC metropolitan area.

Specific Duties

Implement configuration tasks per direction from task lead
Participate in defining system integration and user-acceptance test plans.
Assist with the analysis of bug fixes/ issues.
Partner with the business areas in the creation of process workflow documentation and user manuals.
Execute client communication including various written communications to include one-on-one client conversations.
Create customer reports as required.

SPA's Critical Infrastructure Group (CIG) has an immediate need for a Junior Business Program Analyst who will provide analytical support in business, financial, cost, or program management to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) office of Countering Weapons of Mass Destruction (CWMD). This person will develop and/or review acquisition documentation, program reports, papers, and procedures as well as prepare business analytical reports for executives or clients.
Responsibilities:
The Junior Business Program Analyst will be responsible for applying comprehensive methods for analyzing business processes. They will be responsible for conducting capabilities-based assessments, analyses of alternatives, cost, and management analyses. They will assist in creating operational views, providing business process input to architecture development, and risk assessment. This person will help develop plans of action and timetables in order to meet established deadlines. They will assist in the development of executive briefings, detailed technical documentation, memos, and contract deliverables.

Experience with DHS Joint Requirements Integration and Management System (JRIMS) Capability Analysis Reports (CAR, Mission Needs Statements (MNS), Concept of Operations (CONOPS).
Experience providing analytical support to the Department of Homeland Security.

Are you ready to join an exceptional team that's rewriting the future of national security and global impact? Welcome to Ardent Eagle Solutions (AES), a dynamic and rapidly expanding small business that's at the forefront of supporting the Federal Government, Department of Defense (DoD), and Intelligence Community (IC) on a global scale.

Overview:
THE OPPORTUNITY
Do you have a passion for solving complex, unstructured problems? Are you a data enthusiast who is eager to investigate the root causes of critical organizational or programmatic performance challenges; and then analyze, report, and develop recommendations for creative solutions?

This role offers you the opportunity to advise and support the Department of Commerce’s Office of Performance Excellence within the Office of the Secretary as we advance our capability to deliver innovative solutions that are pragmatic, scalable, and impactful. This includes working with our team to conduct research, collaborate with stakeholders, analyze and interpret qualitative and quantitative data, develop metrics, and prepare visualizations and dashboards. You’ll be a key partner of the office’s senior management, helping them organize and track team work products, identify internal clients’ needs, gather requirements, and develop recommendations to Department leadership for implementation.

This is your chance to deepen your project management, analytical, and process improvement skills while growing your client relationship management experience by delivering innovative solutions. Your work will directly contribute to the Department’s mission to create the conditions for economic growth and opportunity for all American communities.
Responsibilities:
You will lead or support process improvement projects, analyze program performance, and report progress on the implementing the Department’s Strategic Plan. Over the course of each project, you will collaborate with staff in our office and across the Department to solve unstructured problems by gathering and analyzing data to deliver effective recommendations. You will:
Balance multiple projects ensuring short- and long-term deadlines are met in accordance with our office’s standard procedures.
Uphold excellent quality standards for all deliverables.
Develop project scopes of work, plans of actions and milestones, and analytical approaches.
Perform research, data analysis, and statistical calculations.
Synthesize complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods.
Prepare presentations that analyze progress and strengthen data-driven decision making.
Compose or edit memoranda, instructions, promotional materials, newsletters, and social media.
Develop easy-to-understand data visualizations including charts and dashboards.
Plan, schedule, develop agendas, and take notes for meetings and conferences.
Ensure data, databases, and electronic files are managed in accordance with office policies.
Manage office’s workload/work project tracker tool and support other administrative management tasks.
Qualifications:
Approximately 8 years of experience with business improvement analysis, performance data analysis, and knowledge management. Prior consulting experience is critical.
An entrepreneurial and collaborative attitude with ability to establish trust-based relationships.
Demonstrate sound judgement and comfort working in a face-paced, ambiguous environment.
Outstanding drive and process management, with attention to detail and proactive style.
Ability to work under pressure with a solid sense for setting priorities and managing time.
Demonstrated ability to use multiple analytical approaches to optimize processes and programs.
Extensive knowledge and experience analyzing data, synthesizing findings, and concisely presenting recommendations to clients that boost an organization’s innovation, strategies, customer service, or other specified conclusions.
High level proficiency with the full Microsoft Office 365 Suite with the ability to use databases and business analytics software efficiently and effectively.
Education:
Bachelor's Degree


Certification(s):
Lean Six Sigma, DMAIC, SIPOC, Agile, Project Management, and similar Process Improvement Training/Certifications are a major plus.
Work Hours and Location:
Core work hours are 8:30 am – 5:00 pm Monday through Friday. Work performed shall not exceed 40 hours per week.
The office complies with the Department’s current flexible hybrid work environment with 3 days working in the Headquarters office with the option to telework on Mondays and Fridays. Additional situational telework may be approved on an infrequent basis.
Location:
Department of Commerce Headquarters located downtown Washington, DC which has an onsite food court, gym, bank, and relaxation courtyard.

At InnovaSystems, extraordinary solutions are born through innovative software.

A wholly owned subsidiary of Cydecor, InnovaSystems is a leading provider of information technology and enterprise-level solutions to the Department of Defense, federal, state, and local government agencies, delivering a vital service to support our nation’s National Security Strategy. We engage organizational effectiveness and readiness resulting in reduced costs, increased effectiveness, and accessibility.

As a member of the InnovaSystems team, you will be empowered to do the best work of your career with challenging assignments and collaborative teams that solve real-world problems.

Some of our perks & benefits include:

Flexible schedule & telecommute options, continuous learning opportunities, comprehensive benefits package, 401k plan w/ company match, competitive salary and a fantastic culture of collaboration.

*Due to the nature of our business, U.S. citizenship and the ability to obtain a DoD security clearance is required.

Job Role

InnovaSystems is seeking a senior level BSA-SME with the ability to perform exceptional data analysis and detailed requirements building supporting United States Space Force readiness reporting objectives for FY23 and beyond. This includes helping to shape policy, forecast readiness shortfalls, and generate future requirements to address senior leader reporting requirements.

The successful candidate will have specialized knowledge in reporting compliance, policy, and relevant leadership.

The senior BSA-SME will:

Provide guidance and actively participate in requirements reviews, client support, testing and everyday readiness analysis in support of Space readiness assets
Research and capture business needs and act as a proxy for the users and customers by interfacing directly with developers, subject matter experts, stakeholders, and testers to ensure the end-state functionality is acceptable in fulfilling the identified customer value
On the data side, will work with appropriate organizations to identify relevant data sources as the primary liaison for Memorandums of Understanding/Memorandum of Agreement

As a key member of the team, the BSA-SME will be required to analyze data for inconsistencies such as missing/bad data and support complex queries from data source partners or customers. Will also take point on coordinating with the DoD customer to communicate product status and alignment to the organization's needs. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are needed for success in regular meetings with senior military officers involved in plans, policy, training management, and readiness assessment.

Skills Required

At least 7-10 years of experience as a subject matter expert working with readiness and readiness reporting. Must be familiar with policy, directives, and current top task items, especially with Space Force.

SPECIAL SKILLS OR TRAINING:

Effective written and oral communication skills a must
Ability to train readiness at multiple levels: leadership, MAJCOMs, Wings, Unit Commanders, Unit Admins, etc.
Ability to communicate with customers, stakeholders, and an agile software development team
Proficiency in MS Office Suite a must
Strong organizational, time management, and meeting facilitation skills

Skills Desired

10+ years of US Air Force experience is desired
Knowledge of METL/SORTS readiness reporting policy
Expertise in current readiness reporting (to include UTC reporting) efforts strongly recommended

Digital Infuzion is seeking a Business/Requirements Analyst to join our team. The platform spans across diseases, domains, and data types. As part of the team, you will be responsible for business analysis, requirements elicitation, and working with the Product Owner(s) to ensure that the system meets or exceeds the customer needs.

Responsibilities

Identify and document business/functional requirements and workflow (“as-is” and “to-be”)
Plan, prepare and interview stakeholders to elicit user requirements and system functionality
Document clear, concise, and unambiguous user requirements and system functionality
Decompose requirements into epics and user stories
Propose, analyze and contrast options for new features/functionality, using qualitative and scenario analysis to surface implications, assumptions and dependencies
Assist in the investigation of reported system issues, by seeking out and reconciling relevant information, drawing appropriate conclusions about the root cause, and determining the optimal next steps
Produce assigned deliverables with an emphasis on specificity, accuracy, and completeness/coverage
Develop wire-frames to assist with requirements development, system design and development
Maintain requirements traceability across the user and functional requirements to the system design and test cases to ensure the implemented functionality meets user requirements
Interface between the Product Owner and the technical team
Advocate for business and user needs during the software development and testing process
Communicate and clarify requirements to development team
Maintain backlog of requirements, change requests, and bugs
Review and/or develop test scripts
Develop user guides and conduct training
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
4+ years’ experience working on web-based systems preferably on an enterprise scale
4+ years’ experience conducting interviews to gather and validate requirements
Experience with process modeling (notation, arrangement/presentation)
Experience supporting a cross-functional team using Agile methodology
Working knowledge of MS Excel/Word/PowerPoint and Atlassian JIRA/Confluence
Comfort with grasping the problem statement/objective(s) and details of varying issues, feature requests, or tasks
Detail-oriented, with a strong commitment to quality and efficiency
Excellent communications (oral and written) skills to facilitate knowledge acquisition, and business modeling
Experience capturing requirements as user stories with testable acceptance criteria
Experience in testing applications

Preferred Education and Experience

Bachelor's in Business Administration/Management/Commerce, Information Technology or a related discipline
Knowledge of business processes within clinical research domain

Who we are:

The Association of American Medical Colleges is a not-for-profit association
dedicated to transforming health care by supporting the entire spectrum of medical education, medical research, patient care, and community collaborations conducted by our member institutions. We are dedicated to the communities we serve and steadfast in our goal to improve the health of people everywhere. The AAMC strives to make a positive impact not only in your career, but in your life. We offer a comprehensive benefits package which features:

Significant employer 403(b) contribution
Public transportation subsidy
Generous paid time off program
Tuition reimbursement
Wellness program
DESCRIPTION
This request is in the Data & Insight team within the Enterprise Applications group at the AAMC. The individual in this role will develop and maintain a portfolio of member data collection (including but not limited to, SRS, GMETrack and Faculty Roster) and reporting applications, support functional and design specifications by gathering business requirements for initiatives that support the strategic objectives of the Association. The individual in this position partners with the functional groups within the business organization to elicit and document business program visions/requirements and then communicates and clarifies business needs to all relevant stakeholders. The individual is expected to assess user needs utilizing industry standard model-driven analysis techniques and a structured requirements process via approved processes, templates and tools throughout the software development life cycle. This individual is also expected to support Technical Delivery Manager (TDM) on project management activities.
RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Perform requirements analysis on MDA business product(s):
Work with Technical Delivery Manager (TDM), business stakeholders and vendors to establish baseline expectations for business portfolio’s visions/requirements and business deliverables.
Work closely with business stakeholders, vendors, architects, and others as necessary to create portfolio framework and artifacts to track requirements change.
Provide business portfolio input in determining scope of requirements based on business priorities and business values.
Capture, define, analyze and translate functional and non-functional business requirements into system user stories/ use cases and requirements specifications that contribute to effective software development.
Lead the elicitation, creation and review of requirements, use cases and other artifacts and clearly communicate requirements to the customer and vendor. Analyze requirements from all actor/user perspectives and identifying alternative paths. Translate business needs into requirements specifications.
Achieve requirements sign-off by business for all functional areas assigned by the PM.
2. Provide an effective liaison between business stakeholders, vendors and various IT teams to provide requirements clarification support
Maintain and track user stories/use cases and requirements specifications through the software development life cycle.
Act as a liaison between the Business, vendors and IT (including architects, tech leads, developers, testers, and operation teams).
Provide guidance to developers and testers regarding the TO-BE processes which will be implemented. Provide clarification of requirements to the vendor, AAMC developers and QA to ensure they fully understand and correctly interpret them.
Facilitate effective and timely communication of requirements issues that will be identified during the design, construction, and QA activities by engaging appropriate representatives from Business, vendor and IT project members and assisting them in reaching the optimal resolution.
Facilitate execution of the change request process to manage requirements changes affecting baseline requirements.
3. Provide product management support to Technical Deliver Manager (TDM) and Business group (DOS)
Support TDM with coordinating business product management activities
Break projects into doable actions and set timeframes, assign tasks to internal teams and assist with schedule management and resource management.
Maintain backlog items in agile project management tool (Jira)
Assist with risk management, analyze risks and opportunities.
Assist with project procurement management.
Act as the point of contact for assigned project(s) and communicate project status to all participants.
Help prepare budgets, use tools to monitor working hours and expenditures.
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation, plans and reports.
Ensure documentation compliance and quality.
Ensure communication compliance and effectiveness.
Assists in preparation of Request for Proposals or Statements of Work
EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
Bachelor’s degree in any discipline with minimum 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, Product Management related role, Project Coordinator, Test Lead.
Experience with data analytics, and reporting software (such as Tableau) a big plus
Strong Interpersonal skills with excellent written and verbal communication skills a must
Strong time management skills a must as you will be working on multiple projects/initiatives.
Experience using artifacts like context diagrams, use cases, process maps and user journey maps.
Experience using process improvement tools, such as Blue Works, Visio a plus.
Experience working in an agile team required. Any experience with distributed teams a big plus
Strong skills to create software performance projections and define product acceptance criteria.
Able to identify articulate existing/as-is process models while identifying aspects of data and technology actions needed to accomplish the desired end state.
Ability to create product/feature roadmaps with priorities in collaboration with business groups by facilitating consensus on portfolio/project objectives, assumptions and constraints amongst stakeholders.
Experience working with remotely located teams desirable but not required.

Remote Work Eligibility
This position is eligible for remote work in the contiguous US
If a bachelor’s degree is required, related work experience may be substituted in some positions. One year of college course work at an accredited institution is equivalent to one year of related work experience.

NIRA Inc, a fast-growing women-owned small business and pioneer in blockchain and supply chain technologies, is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Lead Business Process Analyst to support establishing a process automation factory for a major federal agency, which includes comprehensive process discovery, process automation, discovery, mapping, automation, and integration with the on-going service catalog effort that the team is currently working on. You will engage with the agency's internal stakeholders, analyzing existing processes, and utilizing the BPMN 2.0 framework for process mapping.

You will excel in this role if you are:

Well-Rounded: You bring in-depth experience across multiple and varying technologies and Business domains especially working with Federal agencies
Solution-Oriented: You are capable of being customer-facing, to help build solutions that increase value proposition.
Big Picture Thinker with Execution Know-How: You can understand a customer or team member's overarching goal while designing enterprise solutions that address those goals.
Agile: Able to work as part of a technical team working together to develop solutions for use by a multitude of customers.
Motivated: You want to continually learn new things, work with new technologies, and identify new business opportunities - helping to expand your project.

Responsibilities:

Engage with business and IT executives to discover and document current business processes and identify opportunities for process improvement and automation
Document using BPMN 2.0 framework representing the sequence of activities, rules, data and events.
Conduct process discovery of existing processes using process mining tools.
Lead large discovery sessions with SME's and stakeholder groups to formulate business outcomes, identify customer personas and and develop customer journeys and experiences.
Document and validate to-be process with stakeholders ensuring accuracy, efficiency,
and viability.
Lead efforts to identify and integrate automated processes to the service catalog by working with the service catalog team.
Develop knowledge base, documents and training materials of all work performed within the process factory.
Develop successful relationships across senior stakeholders to garner support and accelerate delivery.

Required Skills & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related fields.
10+ years of experience in Business Process Analysis and Enterprise Application development
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to design innovative solutions.
Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
Strong experience with BPMN processes, tools and best practices
Strong experience supporting business process analysis and using BPMN framework
Experience with DevSecOps and pipeline automation
Knowledge of IT security principles, compliance standards, and data privacy regulations.
Proficiency in, or understanding of, system integration and automation using APIs, scripting languages, or workflow engines.
Deep knowledge of various enterprise level platforms widely used in the industry.

Preferred Skills & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related fields.
7+ years of relevant work experience with federal government to support business architecture.
Highly skilled in creating visual concepts, creating and editing content to communicate ideas.
Exhibit deep knowledge and experience in designing for and implementing IT solutions
Knowledge of IT security principles, compliance standards, and data privacy regulations.
Proficiency in, or understanding of, system integration and automation using APIs, scripting languages, or workflow engines.
Deep knowledge of various enterprise level platforms widely used in the industry.

ICF is a rapidly growing, entrepreneurial, multi-faceted consulting company, seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support our Federal customers. ICF works with government representatives and users to build and enhance systems.
This Senior BA will participate in building and integrating web-based applications to support our Federal customers. This Senior Business Analyst will work directly with customers and internal subject matter experts to understand the business goals and objectives of the project, and then translate those findings into actionable specifications for delivery. The Senior Business Analyst will work with technical leads to design new features and functionality based on customer need, collaborate with the development team to refine requirements, and manage solutions from design and development through production deployment. The Senior Business Analyst will produce technical documents detailing integration points and features for multiple applications. The ICF team performs custom software development to modernize and integrate siloed, legacy applications using modular design standards. The team works closely with clients and other contractors to ensure the performance and reliability of public-facing, mission-critical applications.
What you’ll be doing:
Manage and support daily work requests for the project team by:
Support all aspects of our IT delivery lifecycle including requirements, design, testing and delivery of web-based tools, though primary function will focus on requirements, design and implementation

Engaging with end-users to understand business needs to develop and document requirements
Developing technical documents in support of the integration of multiple applications and development of new application features
Communicating with multiple teams to ensure requirements are clear and well understood from a functional and technical perspective

Communicating with clients and the team about the status of work
Conducting demos or training necessary for the successful execution of the project

Bachelor’s Degree in related field
5+ years’ experience working on web and/or software development teams
5+ years’ experience conducting and leading interviews to gather and validate requirements
3+ years’ experience in documenting requirements and specifications for web and/or software development teams
3+ years' experience with technical writing and developing technical requirements documents
US Citizenship is required (required by the federal government for this position).
Must be able to obtain Public Trust clearance.
MUST RESIDE IN THE United States (U.S.) and the work MUST BE PERFORMED in the United States (U.S.), as this work is for a federal contract and laws do apply

Experience developing standard documentation, including requirement and design specifications, use cases, and other supporting system documentation

Experience with government grants
Experience with technical writing and developing technical requirements documents
Excellent oral and written communication skills, especially in a client interaction context and in facilitating large team meetings to drive delivery
Experience scoping work efforts into actionable pieces for delivery
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with Agile Scrum methods
Swift ability to break down tasks into Epics, Stories & Tasks
Ability to work independently and within one or more teams with excellent time management, organizational, and reporting skills

Child Care Aware® of America, our nation’s leading voice for child care, works with more than 400 state and local Child Care Resource and Referral agencies (CCR&Rs) to ensure that families in every local community have access to quality, affordable child care.




Child Care Aware of America (CCAoA) is committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce. Our mission is to advance a child care system that effectively serves all children and families. Joining our efforts provides a powerful opportunity to make a difference in the lives of families and to advocate for the approximately 1.5 million child care providers in the United States. Summary of Position: The Business Analyst Associate (BAA) works closely with the Product Development team for our Military Program software tools. The BAA evaluates internal systems, practices, and processes to see how they can best support the Military work along with the Product Manager based on what the customers, users, and the market desire. The BAA works with the software engineering team to determine what internal business challenges, technical restraints, and known risks are in relation to Military Programs software tools and help create action items leading to needed solutions.




The BAA also ensures that everyone is working in unison, both customers and users, to assist the organization in being profitable, solving current business challenges, and attaining their objectives more effectively. A core responsibility is ensuring the business process is updated and documented during the project. This objective is to ensure that anyone with access to the product is aware of its current stage.




Position Duties and Responsibilities:

Assist in developing processes, products, and applications aligned with overall business objectives and priorities.
As part of an Agile Team, act as a link between a Product Team and users, customers, and other stakeholders/executives, bridging the shared understanding gap amongst all interested and involved parties.
Assist the Product Manager with identifying opportunities to improve efficiency and accuracy within the product.
Facilitate discussions with business owners to ensure the necessary software solutions are provided based on the needs expressed by the business team.
Assist the Product Manager with documenting product requirements, typically in the form of User Stories.
Assist the Product Manager with documenting product development planning and reporting documents in various tools such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Assist the Product Manager in bringing alignment to the needs of business and product by gathering, analyzing, and documenting business scenarios.
Assess and analyze root causes of business issues and develop appropriate resolutions.
Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized systems integration and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations.
Utilize feedback to improve work and build what has been learned.
Assist with test plans and quality reviews with business partners.
Participate in a team-oriented work environment and maintain respectful, professional working relationships.



Qualifications:

Has a bachelor's degree or graduate degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent related work experience.
Possesses subject matter expertise and exceptional prior knowledge about the type of product being built and is familiar with the typical business objectives, business rules/processes, and requirements that inform the plans and projections of a Product Development Team.
Problem solver with attention to detail and can lead or augment a team of subject matter experts in identifying, analyzing, and documenting what the product users need and what the business stakeholders need the product to do as well.
Possess exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
Possess high ethical standards and the ability to maintain strict confidentiality.
Possesses prior knowledge or is willing to become familiar with how to be an effective contributor to an Agile product development team that is following Scrum, Kanban, or another popular Agile framework.
Proven multi-tasking capability, sense of urgency, organizational skills, and full-lifecycle software product team skills.
Ability to write shorthand and long-form documents that demonstrates a prior mastery of writing in a clear, concise, and crisp manner that is fitting with the business and technical writing needs of a Product Development Team.
Ability to learn the User Story writing format or can quickly learn and adapt to the writing style.
Ability to collect, analyze, and present information in diverse document formats and for diverse audiences, e.g., preparing information for engineers, the business team, and executive audiences.

Peraton is currently hiring a Sr. Cyber Operations Analyst who will be responsible for integrating knowledge, information, and data from a variety of partners, to include the U.S. Intelligence Community (IC), State, local, tribal, and territorial (SLTT), the private sector, international partners, the U.S. critical infrastructure, and computer network defense communities.

Apply knowledge of data, information, processes, organizational interactions, skills, and analytical expertise, as well as systems, networks, and information exchange capabilities to accomplish mission needs.

Assesses project issues and develops resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and agency's satisfaction goals and objectives.
Develops mechanisms for monitoring project progress and for intervention and problem solving with project managers, line managers, and analysts.
Establish measures of effectiveness for cyber plans and activities that examine current processes and prior cyber incidents for lessons learned and best practices.
Coordinate and facilitate internal and external partner engagements facilitating information exchange and responding to requests for information or assistance.

Ability to identify, analyze, and resolve program support deficiencies required.

Active Top Secret security clearance with eligibility to obtain SCI required. In addition, selected candidate will be required to obtain and maintain a favorably adjudicated DHS background investigation (EOD) for continued employment.

About Copper River & The Native Village of Eyak:

Owned by the Native Village of Eyak (NVE), a federally recognized Alaska Native Tribe, the Copper River Family of Companies are a collection of entities that deliver a complementary set of solutions and services to support the diverse missions and requirements of our clients. SUMMARY

The Business Performance Analyst collects, analyzes, documents, and communicates performance measure data results internally. Working on behalf of internal programs, the Business Performance Analyst conducts root-cause analysis to improve the performance of internal programs, drafts recommendations for managers and prepares visualizations that clarify results. The Business Performance Analyst facilitates business plan development at the department and office level and interacts regularly with managers to inform internal performance measurement reporting. The incumbent also performs departmental strategic assessments, efficiency analyses, budgeting, and financial reporting, as well as conducts special departmental studies and analyzes expense trends and budget variances to direct future monthly expenditures and adjustments and to ensure efficient management of department resources.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Collects, analyzes, documents, and prepares internal reports on performance measures to evaluate how effectively Quality Assurance, Internal Compliance and Oversight (QICO) is meeting strategic goals, business plan objectives and/or mitigating risks.
Analyzes measures not performing at target to discover and document root-cause and applicable business processes impacted.
Prepares and communicates performance analysis results and recommendations to supervisor and internal programs within QICO, utilizing tables, graphs, PowerPoint presentations, and narratives.
Gathers feedback from managers on performance reporting needs and summarizes in narrative format for supervisor’s and Vice President’s (VP) review.
Gathers program performance data and customer comments and compiles information for the generation of monthly key performance indicator (KPIs) reports for supervisor and VP review.
Supports QICO business plan development by interviewing managers and documenting core services, key accomplishments, priorities, actions, performance measures and risks to achieving strategic goals.
Completes detailed analysis of departmental annual operating budget submissions, monthly expense trends, and budget variances to ensure compliance within the allocated budget
Prepare cost analysis crosswalk reports to determine best price for office supplies, materials, and vendor services.
Prepares routine safety reports related to Roadway Worker Protection (RWP) compliance and Non-Revenue Vehicle (NRV) usage for supervisor and VP review to ensure compliance with policy and instructions and safety training requirements
Performs high-level analysis of Authority-wide transit data for trends in areas of safety to assist in quality assurance internal audits and reviews to mitigate risks.
Serves as internal consultant to VP and managerial staff as it relates to routine monitoring of data results, clarifying challenges and bringing insights to facilitate process improvement.
Works in collaboration with QICO program teams to coordinate receipt of completed team training to include in departmental training matrix master database.
Supports departmental operations of QICO HQ and two satellite offices.
Coordinates routine updates to Department Continuity of Operations Plan (COOP) and assists in planning scheduled and unscheduled drills in coordination with the Office of Emergency Management (OEM) to ensure compliance with COOP protocols.

The functions listed are not intended to limit specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Nor is it intended to limit in any way the right of managers and supervisors to assign, direct and control the work of employees under their supervision.

Consideration will be given to applicants whose resumes demonstrate the required education and experience. Applicants should include all relevant education and work experience.

Evaluation criteria may include one or more of the following:

Skills and/or behavioral assessment
Personal interview
Verification of education and experience (including certifications and licenses)
Criminal Background Check (a criminal conviction is not an automatic bar to employment)
Medical examination including a drug and alcohol screening (for safety sensitive positions)
Review of a current motor vehicle report

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us enhance the hiring experience for internal and external stakeholders, this is your chance to make history. We are looking for a dynamic, and organized self-starter to join as a Business Analyst for our Workforce Intelligence (WFI).

The Business Analyst role will be responsible for diving into the complex data sets and analyzing the intricacies of our systems and processes. Key areas of responsibility include researching and analyzing data sets, participation in projects, and partnering with WFI on building tools, automating reporting, research and deep dives.

This role requires a strong blend of project management skills, with an ability to conduct in-depth analyses, think big, and identify opportunities.

Key job responsibilities

Data mining and problem solving to present analysis in easily digestible standard reports
Design, optimize, and compile queries using SQL to generate reports in QuickSight, MS Excel etc.
Development of data collection processes and data management systems
Maintenance of data integrity
In-depth research of defect trends, data collection, and entry as needed
Gather and understand data requirements, work with the team to build systems that can process and transform the data
Modeling data and metadata to support ad-hoc and pre-built reporting
Manage business critical initiatives to enforce standard work and reduce waste
About the team
The vision of Workforce Intelligence is to design the ideal workforce to meet the customer promise anywhere. This organization leads and influences global workforce strategies that enable Amazon to scale more efficiently while also providing a unique voice for the hourly workforce. This is accomplished through a variety of science driven initiatives, KPI analysis and reporting, predictive modeling, and data engineering.

Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer-centric company on earth and Workforce Staffing, the organization responsible for hourly associate hiring globally, is on the front lines of that mission and will be your core customer in this role.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Arlington, VA, USA | Dallas, TX, USA | Seattle, WA, USA


Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools

Overview:

The purpose of this task order is to provide professional service personnel to support the OIG Office of the Executive Director, IT Operations Directorate, through subject matter expertise with project management for large complex projects related to EX/IT’s mission-centric approach to IT operations focused on customer service, collaboration, and innovation.

OIG is seeking support from a contractor to assist the Government in providing project management and business analyst support services for the U.S. Department of State, Office of Inspector General (OIG). The objective is to support EX/IT and OIG program office mission needs by identifying business requirements, initiating, and managing projects, and supporting a comprehensive approach to IT across OIG. All work must conform to OIG’s enterprise policies and procedures, including but not limited to IT governance and management.

Responsibilities:

Manage full lifecycle of assigned IT projects.
Work closely with all teams including team members, stakeholders and vendors as directed by Chief Information Officer (CIO) or designate to capture all projects in EX/IT.
Create and keep up to date project plans and document project tasks, timeframes, milestones, deliverables, and dates of completion.
Maintain and keep up to date, project plans, operational task tracking lists using various tools as directed.
Manage operational tasks in addition to tasks for established projects.
Collaborate with IT budget staff and other offices in EX as required.
Interface with other OIG offices by attending meetings and reaching out to established contacts.
Gather, ensure the completeness and accuracy of, and provide trend analysis on program and project data.
Create standard operating procedures and other technical documentation.

Qualifications:

Five years of project analyst experience, preferably with federal government agencies/departments with Information Technology projects
Five years of experience planning, supervising, and managing software applications development, maintenance, and migration efforts; network engineering, implementation, and maintenance projects; business reengineering; or other assignments relevant to the project or requirement.
Three years of experience successfully working with cross-functional IT and non-IT teams and team members.
Three years of experience using Microsoft Office 365 such as SharePoint Online, Power Automate Flow, Teams, Lists.

Overview:
Systems Planning and Analysis, Inc. (SPA) delivers high-impact, technical solutions to complex national security issues. With over 50 years of business expertise and consistent growth, we are known for continuous innovation for our government customers, in both the US and abroad. Our exceptionally talented team is highly collaborative in spirit and practice, producing Results that Matter. Come work with the best! We offer opportunity, unique challenges, and clear-sighted commitment to the mission. SPA: Objective. Responsive. Trusted.


The Undersea Technology Analysis Group (UTAG), within the Maritime Division in SPA, supports the Navy and other government organizations with timely and objective capability assessments, technology evaluations, and strategic planning that integrate the technical, operational, programmatic, policy, and business aspects of undersea warfare (USW) and broader Navy issues. One of UTAG’s clients is the Chief of Naval Operations Undersea Warfare Division (OPNAV N97). OPNAV N97 is responsible for identifying, analyzing, and proposing requirements and resourcing objectives for the development, procurement, and operation of U.S. submarines and their payloads. UTAG supports this program with strategic evaluation and planning, external engagement, integration, and operations research and analysis.

SPA has an immediate need for a passionate and dedicated individual focused on national security issues relating to the Navy's Undersea Warfare capabilities and responsibilities, including missions, platforms, payloads, and people. #CJ #IN123
Responsibilities:
SPA is seeking a great candidate to provide direct support and input to OPNAV N97 and partner organizations (such as the Fleet, NAVSEA, ONR, DARPA, UWDC, etc). SPA uses a wide range of analytical approaches to find rigorous and objective answers to our clients’ most difficult national security problems. The candidate will be part of a team of analysts responsible for shaping undersea warfare investments, assessing undersea operations, security and survivability, and identifying desired force structure and capabilities for future undersea forces. The candidate will contribute to mature and meaningful recommendations to SPA’s clients that reflect the range of operational and technical factors needed to make informed decisions, including development and presentation of briefings, papers, and analytical results in support of decision-making.
Qualifications:

Required Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline or relevant field. A Master’s degree is preferred.
At least 3-5 years of experience in SSN operations, SSBN operations, and/or undersea warfare.
Demonstration of strong skill sets in research, writing, critical thinking, and analysis.
Possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to summarize and communicate complex ideas and analytical findings to a variety of audiences.
US Citizen with ability to obtain and retain DoD Secret clearance.

Desired Qualifications:

Experience analyzing metrics and conducting operational or technical risk assessment or root cause analysis especially in the areas of undersea warfare.
Experience directly interacting with, briefing, and advising DoD or armed service decision makers.

Job Title: Capital Planning and Analytics Professional (Hybrid - 3 Days in Office)
Job Description:
At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.

Position Overview:

The Capital Planning and Analytics team is seeking a confident, self-motivated, and analytical Professional with strong financial analytical skills, project management, and communication skills.

The Capital Planning and Analytics Professional will be responsible for creating and analyzing capital related processes and priorities – and to support prioritize and drive execution of such deliverables. The role will partner extensively with colleagues across Finance, Business Functions, Risk, Regulatory Affairs as well as other functions and lines of businesses. Additionally, the role requires strong analytical, project management, and communication skills. The candidate will work on initiatives that will provide a unique opportunity to gain a broad understanding of many key business attributes related to capital planning, management, analytics, and forecasting.

Our Impact:

The Capital Planning division is responsible for the planning, forecasting, and optimization of capital. The team focuses on the oversight of all capital management, capital planning and elements related to risk appetite and capital contingency, as well as strategic and policy initiatives. The team’s activities are focused on both business-as-usual and stress environments and ties closely with other areas within the Finance function including Financial Planning and Analysis and Stress Testing. Our team:

Prepares spot capital reporting per the regulator requirements

Prepares Annual Capital Plan submission to FHFA

Collaborates with the division ﬁnance areas as well as division risk ofﬁcers (DROs) in the implementation of the recently enacted Enterprise Capital Rule and coordinates associated regulatory submissions.

Drives the optimization of capital in partnership with other areas within Finance and the business areas to improve the systems and processes currently utilized to perform these activities.

Develops the strategies and tools to accurately measure and optimize capital capacity and ratios and related measures.

The Capital Planning Team reports to the VP of Capital who reports to the Chief Financial Ofﬁcer and this is an excellent opportunity to be part of a results-driven team that will implement Freddie Mac’s Capital Planning and Management Strategy.

Your Impact:

As a member of the Capital Planning Team you will:

Assist in preparation of quarterly submissions of ERCF & ROCET1 templates to our regulator. Analyze and explain drivers for various components and metrics related to required capital and capital shortfalls

Analyze actual returns and capital levels against capital plan and policy Assist in preparation of quarterly ERCF Public Disclosure content

Comply with appropriate controls during each reporting period

Understand capital data structure and make enhancements to the structure and/or reports as needed

Assist in analysis to support comment letter based on Notice of Proposed Rule making by FHFA Work on initiatives that will provide a unique opportunity to gain a broad understanding of many key business attributes related to capital planning, management, analytics, and forecasting

Collaborate with fellow team members and other participants within Capital team and others in the Finance organization as well as the Risk organization (second line).

Demonstrate understanding of internal business segments (team members)

Create presentations for senior management, Board of Directors and regulators

Analyze / explain results, review trending and perform sensitivity analysis

Build and maintain reporting templates and documentation of methodologies and execution to support governance requirements

Work within a fast-paced, engaging, and dynamic environment

Qualifications:

Minimum of 2- year experience in financial reporting, planning, forecasting and analytics in banking industry, financial servicing companies and consulting firms etc.

Prior work experience in areas related to analytics, management or banking with best-in-class ﬁrm with focus on capital planning and management is strongly preferred

Strong validated business analysis competency, communication skills and abstract problem-solving capabilities.

High proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, especially Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel required; Experience with VBA and Hyperion Smartview, preferred

An undergraduate degree is required.

Keys to Success in this Role:

Demonstrate good understanding of the capital requirements under the Enterprise Regulatory Capital Framework and their relation to BASEL III

Strong analytical, project management, presentation and communication skills, with the ability to work in a fast-paced team environment

Demonstrate the ability to build good relationships within a large and sophisticated organization – working well with key customers and advancing projects forward

Show ﬂexibility in thinking as we develop new processes as multiple iterations are likely to happen before a workstream is completed

Ask questions and listen while learning - A good amount of the work is related to listening and capturing information from others

Demonstrate robust and extensive knowledge of ﬁnance, economics, accounting, and mortgage market (preferred)

Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site.

Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with differing abilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Resumes received outside the BountyJobs system will be considered unsolicited and Freddie Mac will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. If interested in learning more, please visit www.BountyJobs.com and register with our referral code: MAC.

FLSA Status:Non-Exempt

This position has an annualized market-based salary range of $87,000 - $131,000 and is eligible to participate in the annual incentive program. The final salary offered will generally fall within this range and is dependent on various factors including but not limited to the responsibilities of the position, experience, skill set, internal pay equity and other relevant qualifications of the applicant.

About Us:

ElectroTempo is an innovative data analytics and software startup that specializes in helping our customers de-risk their major electric vehicle investments. We connect transportation and energy networks to power the electrification of the automotive industry. The ElectroTempo platform analyzes complex energy and transportation data to identify optimal infrastructure and fleet strategy. Our team brings leading expertise in transportation, energy, computer science, policy, and regulation to deliver scalable software solutions to accelerate transportation electrification.

We are a well-funded startup backed by multiple VC firms and the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Vehicle Technologies Office. This is a unique opportunity to help shape the transition to an electric future! We strive to be the analytics backbone of strategic planning & impact accounting for EV investment. Come work with us!

About You:

You have experience supporting clients in evaluating and designing business and analytics strategies. You exhibit natural curiosity, a desire to understand new industries and technologies, and an analytical and detail-oriented mindset. You are a team player who is willing and able to roll up your sleeves and do what’s necessary at a startup, even if it’s outside of your job description. You will play a pivotal role in bridging business objectives, data science initiatives, and software development projects directly with our customers to build a rapidly growing machine learning analytics platform. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about working in a startup environment to understand new industries, technology, work closely with technical teams, business teams and customers to ensure the successful delivery of impactful solutions.

Your Role:

Business Case Development - Assist in developing analytical business cases for initiatives and investments for both internal and external clients

Client Support and Requirements Gathering - Work closely with business stakeholders to understand and document project objectives, business processes, and user requirements. Support clients in designing and implementing strategies utilizing ElectroTempo tools and capabilties. Create and maintain detailed documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, and user documentation.

Change Management – Work with customers to explain key software features and ensure successful adoption of the ElectroTempo application

Financial Modeling and Projections – Develop financial models to project and optimize charging infrastucture investments for clients that optimizes for several variables, depending on customer need.

Testing and Quality Assurance - Collaborate with QA teams to develop both product and calculation-based test plans and ensure that delivered technical solutions meet business and customer requirements.

Software Development and Data Science Support - Engage with Software Development and Data Science teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications, and sometimes product feature functionality

Project Coordination - Coordinate project timelines, deliverables, and milestones across data science and software development projects. Work closely with managers to ensure successful project execution.

Collaboration and Relationship Building - Establish relationships with technical and business teams, customers, and working partners. Facilitate communication between business stakeholders, the data science team and developers to ensure alignment.

Work Experience:

5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Management Consultant, preferably in a technology-driven environment.

Understanding of data science concepts and software development processes.

Highly analytic and detail-oriented mindset that can assess quickly and question assumptions.

Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders, and to anticipate needs or

Experience with project management tools and methodologies.

Experience documenting business processes and helping to scale team’s workloads efficiently.

Ability to collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and drive adoption of solutions.

Experience with operations research and thinking critically about how to translate customer challenges into productized technical solutions.

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.

Experience in machine-learning packages, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, random forest, etc.

Experience in a fast-paced and unstructured start-up environment.

Strong understanding of statistics and probability theory.

Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills.

Extreme attention to detail, with high-quality outputs.

Nice to Have:

Experience with Transportation, Finance or Civil Engineering

Experience with machine learning and data analytics

Experience in the commercial real estate, freight, or utility space

Experience with geo-spatial data

Experience with data manipulation using SQL.

Experience with cloud systems such as AWS.

Location:

ElectroTempo has offices in the Washington, D.C. and Seattle, WA metro areas.

We are seeking a Business Analyst to support the leadership of federal agencies in developing solutions and providing services focused on solving complex and high-profile national security issues. This position is hybrid with our client in the Washington, DC Metro Area.

Program Background:

The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Customs and Border Protection (CBP) needs support to assess operational programs, provide analytical support, and liaison across lines of business within CBP to enhance current business processes and reporting capabilities.

Key Responsibilities:

Works in collaborative environment with various CBP project teams to support the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Customs and Border Protection (CBP) mission.
Provides advice, assistance and written recommendations based on data analysis and results. Familiarity with tools such are SAP Business Objects, Power BI, Qlik, Tableau etc.

Liaison with the technical development team by articulating operational and mission needs.

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT

Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.
