Interested in working in an innovative, collaborative environment with motivated, social people? At Arc Aspicio, you can join a leading consulting firm that specializes in human capital, management, and strategy professional services to deliver compelling solutions. Consultants join our practice focused on mission-critical projects, and quickly learn to contribute to and grow our company across multiple projects. We invest in hiring, mentoring, and training smart, diverse, and self-driven professionals interested in all aspects of the company and our homeland security and government clients. We are looking for people who are willing to share ideas and work as part of an inclusive, innovative team.

Research Associates (Justice Grants Programs) join our company as to support mission-critical projects in justice and homeland security while also helping to strategically grow the company. This is a great role for someone who has 3-5 years of relevant work experience in program analysis, research, and performance measurement related grants in a fast-paced environment. Analysts work in a fun, customer service-oriented team on challenging projects and like to learn and collaborate.

Hybrid Work Environment: Arc Aspicio is currently working in a hybrid work environment where employees at client sites, the Arc Aspicio DC office, and, as approved, remotely on a part-time basis. Candidates must live in the Washington, DC area on their start date, ready to work with their team.

Responsibilities

Design and develop logic models, performance measures, and data collection programs
Analyze performance measures and other justice data using Excel macros, SPPS, ArcGIS, and Access
Communicate research and analytical findings both verbally and in writing to a variety of audiences
Serve as primary point of contact for all performance measurement related support
Provide exceptional customer service and performance related support
Problem-solve, performance basic research, and escalate issues when needed
Join our consulting practice to support projects and company growth initiatives, managing multiple workstreams at one time
Collaborate with our clients to solve tough problems, delivering outstanding client service and achieving mission results
Apply excellent consulting, research, business analysis, and communications skills to quickly identify problems, analyze challenges, and recommend solutions to our team and our clients
Develop consulting skills and help grow the company outside of your project by participating in new business and strategic initiatives
Contribute to our company culture, which promotes client-focused teamwork, learning, and helping others to grow and develop

Required Qualifications

3-5 years of relevant experience in research, program analysis, and customer service
Ability to work in grants management, helping to make sure grants are effectively administered to achieve justice outcomes
Direct experience with client and stakeholder engagement (including senior-level leaders) and delivering work products for clients in a complex stakeholder environment
Outstanding written and oral communication and collaboration skills and strong leadership potential
Ability to collaborate and work effectively remotely and in-person
Technologically savvy, especially with Microsoft products and use of collaboration tools (SharePoint preferred)

Job Title: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Business Analyst Washington DC Area
Job Description:
Company Description


Established in 2015, The Efficiency Group is a small, process improvement/Lean Six Sigma (LSS) training and consulting firm dedicated to helping business or government organizations improve operational performance in a practical, commonsense manner using LSS techniques. Our unique HELIX approach emphasizes understanding and working within an organization’s culture to deploy improved business processes and support business process optimization. Through our training and implementation support, The Efficiency Group is changing the paradigm of traditional Lean Six Sigma training and its utilization.

The Efficiency Group is looking to add the right people to its cadre of LSS practitioners. We want smart, hardworking, driven people who put their customers first but understand a work-life balance. We want individuals dedicated to their customers, the company, and themselves who recognize that we can grow better together when we all work together as one. We want individuals who understand and are knowledgeable in LSS tools and techniques but who also understand the limitations of a “one size fits all” approach to process improvement. We look for leaders, doers, and team players who work to make themselves better through their work, their interactions with colleagues, their leadership of projects, and their role in the community.

The Efficiency Group is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace; is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.



Job Description


This is a hybrid position located in the Washington DC area.

Provide technical support to a federal agency in streamlining its operational processes using process modeling, analysis, Lean Six Sigma and reengineering techniques, as required. Support the effort to develop guidance document development framework and guidance documentation content and maintenance to the same agency/project. Support all project management activities including project schedule development and maintenance, status meeting scheduling and leadership, task coordination, and quality assurance.

This is a senior project support position, and the successful candidate will be responsible for helping to operationally execute this project to effectively meet all project requirements and customer expectations.

Job Responsibilities

As part of a Team, support all Project Management activities including development and monitoring of a master project schedule, tracking parallel workstreams, provide strategy and support to project-related communications, leading client and task lead interactions, ensure outstanding quality to all developed materials.
Bring a positive attitude, a can-do spirit, professionalism, and the flexibility to be part of a growing successful team.
Support all BPR and process improvement activities as dictated by the project and directed by the client including but not limited to:
Developing and supporting prioritization of a process inventory
Defining process improvement project charters featuring scope, risks, SMEs, etc.
Support scheduling and executing all Kaizen event sessions
Understanding the as-is, identifying challenges and improvement opportunities, agreeing on improvement strategies for the to-be, etc.
Supporting the development of all process models using the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN)
Supporting the development, scheduling and briefing project and organizational leadership on an ongoing basis regarding individual process improvement projects, the overall effort, specific topics, etc.
Supporting development of corresponding to-be process documentation such as but not limited to a process narrative or standard operating procedure, job aids, frequently asked questions, etc.
Supporting to-be process deployment activities including the development and delivery of training, communications, and change management materials.
Support Continuous Process Improvement (CPI) efforts.
Support development of a framework process for organizational guidance document development and maintenance. Lead development of framework requirements – including appropriate corresponding processes and requirements – and support execution of framework processes.
Support maintenance of organizational guidance documentation through the conduct of content audits, pipeline development and tracking for organizational standard operating procedures and policies, manage the review and vetting process for documentation review, maintain documentation metadata, support updating/uploading to client intranet.
Support client intranet improvement efforts as related to guidance document publishing, searching, retrieving, and support improved access to developed and deployed guidance documents.
Support close coordination with other, appropriate client initiatives to ensure proper alignment and alignment, as appropriate.
Support development of an organizational content management strategy through the review and maturation of governance standards.
Support development of appropriate documentation frameworks and content standards for multiple types of documents including standard operating procedures, job aids, etc.
Work with organizational subject matter experts to develop or update guidance documents as dictated by organizational leadership. Develop the processes related to the guidance documents then develop the corresponding documentation based of the developed framework.
Coordinate the content development and updating of process by scheduling and supporting all appropriate meetings, conducting research on governance policies and regulations, and benchmarking peer organizations, preparing first draft of processes/guidance documents, coordinating and supporting the vetting and review process, developing final versions of all documents, developing appropriate change management and communications materials, supporting deployment to the client intranet, and continuously reviewing processes for efficiency and documentation for updating.
Support Job Aid development and alignment to internal client tracking system.
Actively work to intimately understand the client environment, actors, requirements, etc. and become the client’s “trusted partner” for all things process or documentation related.
Actively work to expand the project to new areas in support of meeting client needs and expectations.
Develop training materials and deliver training to organizational staff, as necessary, on developed guidance document framework.
Provide other client support, as tasked.


Qualifications

Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification
Mimimum of 3 years experience with process improvement, Lean Six Sigma, etc.
Bachelor's Degree required with a Master's preferred.
Direct experience with process improvement and understanding business process goals, systems, data, people requirements, and identifying opportunities for improvements across all aspects individually and collectively.
Experience with using LSS techniques in government/non-manufacturing enviroments requried. This is not a typcial LSS deployment and requires understanding, knowledge and expertise is deploying LSS in a government agency.
Experience developing organizational documents including procedured documentation and job aids.
Experience in interacting with client staff and leadership in the development of processes, frameworks, communications, training, and change management materials.
Experience working as a part of a team to achieve client-driven objectives and requirements.
Experience interacting with Project leadership to define project goals, objectives, purpose, and then executing on defined requirements.
Experience with SharePoint or MS Team workflow development and implementation a plus.
Experiences or knowledge in process simulations and simulations analysis a plus.
Experience or knowledge in robotic process automation (RPA) a plus.
Direct experience with developing process models in MS Visio.
Ability to commute to client site in Bethesda area required.
Hybrid work environments are supported but candidates must be located within the Washington DC, Maryland, Northern Virginia (DMV) area. Travel to customer sites is not reimbursed for hybrid employees.

Additional Information


Skills, Abilities and Behaviors

Focused on the customer, their needs, expectations and requirements.
A positive attitude, humility, and flexibility in working with others
A doer with willingness to be part of a growing team doing great work for great clients
Effective, experienced team player able to support both large and small project teams, to drive towards solutions, and engage participants in a positive way to facilitate organizational improvement.
Experience with effective communications development and delivery
Empathic and commonsense understanding of Lean Six Sigma and BPR tools and techniques, and their practical implementation within organizations resistant to change.
Able to work individually or in groups to identify customer challenges, determine strategies for meeting those strategies, developing processes implementing those strategies, and supporting to-be process adoption across an enterprise.
Excellent writing skills.
Team player ready to focus on the customer while helping The Efficiency Group and themselves grow.

Tools & Technologies

MS Office Suite
MS Visio
MS Project

Salary Range: $80K - $95K

Job Title: Business Line Analyst - Renewables and Clean Power
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 272872

Relocation Authorized: National - Family
Telework Type: Part-Time Telework
Work Location: Reston, VA


Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place. Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers’ objectives to create a lasting positive impact. We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations. Core to Bechtel is our values – ethics, safety, quality, people, culture, relationships, innovation and sustainability, and our covenants – integrity, respect, collaboration, trust, and delivery. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver.


Project Overview

This is a role within the Renewable and Clean Power (R&CP) business in the Infrastructure GBU, working across all regions.


Position Summary

Requires a dynamic and innovative professional with a deep knowledge of renewables, traditional and emerging power generation and storage technologies, and who has experience with project management and project execution methodologies. Responsible within the R&CP business to participate in strategy development, market evaluation and execution planning activities including market and customer evaluation, competitor assessments, industry trends, drivers and critical needs, and for recommending teaming arrangements, strategic relationships, and execution lessons learned implementation techniques. Reports to and receives operational and functional supervision from the General Manager for R&CP. Provides support to the Operations Manager and Business Development Managers as required. The role provides a unique opportunity to shape and implement Bechtel’s approach to the historic transition to renewables and clean power solutions.


Responsibilities

Undertakes extensive research, monitoring and evaluation of power market trends, understand customer challenges and target market needs; recommends strategic new services, technical capabilities and sector needs that the company should pursue
Keep informed of customers' & competitors’ present and future plans for growth, projects, and programmatic and technical requirements
Performs necessary research on customer and competition, developing alternate strategies related to value proposition and service offerings
Maintains strategic initiative database and progress for the sector
Identifies and develops R&CP related strategies globally
Participates in planning the business development strategy for the R&CP business
Performs various calculations to help analyze the financial background of targeted markets / prospects
Willing to support and/or lead other aspects of the R&CP strategy implementation including the identification and development of opportunities in other industry verticals
Actively participates in the formalization of the power sector strategy, including board level papers / presentations
Supports the preparation and coordination of marketing and communications content
Demonstrates thorough use of personal knowledge, supplemented by other Bechtel personnel, to resolve how Bechtel RC&P can improve its value propositions
Supports the preparation of corporate approval documents related to prospective work, as may be requested by Operations Managers
Facilitates R&CP business input to BGI and GBU level business planning, monthly updates and other information requests
In coordination with MI, responsible for the overall administration of the R&CP overhead budget and reporting


Qualifications and Skills

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, engineering or related field and 6 years of experience in various roles for power strategy, business development, project management or in lieu of a degree, 12 years of related work experience
Strong background and experience in Renewables and other power generation technologies


Additional Qualifications

Experience with the application of renewable energy technologies (Solar, Wind, BESS)
Ability to learn new technologies and assess the value of business goals and strategy
Knowledge of company capabilities and services available to customers
Knowledge of current resources to identify power market and industry trends
Deep understanding of competitive products and consumer trends and experience in developing qualification documents, proposals, and customer presentations
Ability to explain and communicate Bechtel’s value proposition, execution approach and commercial positions to internal stakeholders and customers through knowledge and authenticity
Skill in oral and written communication with demonstrated ability in making presentations to customers and management
Demonstrated initiative and intensity to develop new business strategies and work with others to improve and communicate effectively to senior management
Self-directed, requires limited daily supervision or guidance
Proven ability to work effectively in fluid environments
Ability to influence internally without direct authority with strong covenant-based behavior
Works well with teams and other departments including working effectively with senior managers in a collaborative yet challenging manner
Responsive to internal and external customers with consistent follow-up and follow-through
Understanding of energy storage technology including both Battery Energy Storage Systems and long duration energy storage solutions and the challenges to overcome for large scale commercial application
Knowledge of corporate policies and directives related to proposal and contract formulation
Good proficiency in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel

This position requires organization, attention to detail, exceptional communication skills, and strong working knowledge of Department of Energy (DOE) acquisition management principles, with a focus on DOE Order 413.3B compliance. Department of Energy, Office of Project Management, Project Controls Division (PM-30) staff member responsible for analyzing monthly Earned Value Management (EVM) data, participating in EVMS and Acquisition reviews of capital asset construction projects, and updating DOE policies and procedures.

Exciting Opportunity at ISS: Join our Governance Research Team as a Project Manager!
Are you a dynamic individual seeking career advancement in the management of Governance Research activities? ISS is offering a fantastic opportunity for you to join our team. By taking on this role, you'll have the chance to contribute to our organization's growth and make a significant impact.
As a skilled Project Manager, you will be responsible for planning and executing multiple concurrent business and software projects. Your primary focus will be the effective management of significant Research projects with a global scope. This involves ensuring the successful delivery of project commitments and maintaining clear communication with key stakeholders around the globe, including ISS Research leadership, Data teams, Research analysts, and other departments.
In addition to project management, you will also lead in the planning, implementation, and introduction of projects related to new systems and technologies. This role offers a dynamic, and diverse set of responsibilities, by occasionally working outside of standard business hours to facilitate effective collaboration, allowing you to contribute to the development and success of our organization.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities
Lead planning and/or implementation of program.

Develop methods to monitor project or area progress and provide corrective supervision if necessary.
Assemble the project staff; for their technical or functional development, performance, and/or termination during the project or projects.
Manage project resource allocation.
Work cross-functionally to solve problems and implement changes.
Follow a defined, agreed upon project management methodology.
Present oral and written reports defining plans, problems, and resolutions to appropriate levels of management.
May act as Service Delivery Manager, helping with tasks related to the Research Change Management board.
Document/Support change management processes working with our business analyst or using Business Analysis skills to create / modify swim lanes and task flow diagrams.
Collaboration
Pro-actively engages present and future stakeholders in design, priority setting, and implementation.
Builds coalitions among the various stakeholders; negotiates authority to move the project forward.
Creates a sense of belonging and ownership among team members; assembles a team with the right mix of skills
Coaches and motivates team members
Delegates responsibility
Promotes mutual support and interaction.
Consults and provides advice, facilitates discussion, and resolves conflict
Establishes trust; builds and uses cross functional relationships to accomplish work objectives.
Communication Effectiveness
Conveys goals and objectives clearly and in a compelling manner
Listens effectively and clarifies information as needed; interprets verbal and non-verbal messages that others communicate.
Produces clear status reports
Communicates tactfully and candidly.
Ensures that project status, issues and successes are communicated to project team, stakeholders, sponsors, steering committee, and all levels of management and documented appropriately.
Motivates project team members to action. Identifies common themes, makes inferences, and draws conclusions.
Ensures open communication on the project team.
Addresses delicate situations and handles conflicts in such a way as to maximize opportunity and minimize exposure to risk.
Decision Making

Analyzes the risks and future impact of decisions.
Makes decisions and takes timely independent action in pursuit of priorities.

WHO WE ARE



The mission of The Nature Conservancy (TNC) is to conserve the lands and waters upon which all life depends. As a science-based organization, we develop innovative, on-the-ground solutions to the world’s toughest environmental challenges so that people and nature can thrive. Our work is guided by our values, which include a commitment to diversity and respect for people, communities, and cultures. From a rewarding mission to career development and flexible schedules, there are many reasons to love life #insideTNC. Want to know more? Check out our TNC Talent playlist on YouTube to hear stories from staff or visit Glassdoor.

One of TNC’s primary goals is to cultivate an inclusive work environment so that employees around the globe have a sense of belonging and feel that their unique contributions are valued. We know we’ll only achieve our mission by hiring and engaging a diverse staff that reflects the communities in which we work. Recognizing that people bring talent and skills that have been developed outside the scope of a job, we take a holistic approach to recruitment that considers life experience in addition to the professional requirements listed in our postings. Please apply – we’d love to hear from you. To quote a popular saying at TNC, “you’ll join for the mission, and you’ll stay for the people.”

WHAT WE CAN ACHIEVE TOGETHER



The Finance Product Owner is responsible for coordinating and organizing the reporting, development, configuration, testing, launch, and post-implementation support of all those modules of the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system, which principally enable the grants, procurement, accounts payable, accounts receivable, leases, loans, and general ledger functionalities. This position will report to the Controller and sit within The Nature Conservancy’s Finance Business Unit on the PART-C team (Private Awards Center of Excellence, Accounting, Related Entities, Treasury, and Financial Compliance). The PART-C team is a resource and partner that supports TNC’s mission and values to ensure appropriate regulatory and procedural compliance globally. This is a remote role that will interact with teams located around the world.

The Finance Product Owner has overall responsibility for coordinating and organizing the activities and associated personnel for the successful implementation of a new ERP system by coordinating and organizing the development, configuration, testing, and launch of those modules of the ERP system, which principally enable the grants, procurement, accounts payable, accounts receivable, leases, loans, and general ledger functionalities.

They are a subject matter expert in accounting and various finance areas, including but not limited to US GAAP, grants, and procurement, and serve as a resource balancing the strategic goals of the project, the capabilities of the system for its delivery of required finance functionality and the needs of the end-users in all business units to determine the best approach and system configurations. In addition, post implementation of the ERP, the Finance Product Owner will identify the need for and coordinate with the accountable managers for those professional services and outsourcing relationships necessary for the efficient and effective functioning of all those modules of the ERP system, which principally enable the grants, procurement, accounts payable, accounts receivable, leases, loans, and general ledger functionalities, ensure a smooth transition from the prior system(s) and support the finance leadership team with any post-implementation clean up and reconfiguration related to the ERP's financial functionality.

They are the primary liaison on matters pertaining to the finance aspects of the ERP and coordinate with the ERP Program Manager and Project Managers in driving the execution of the system implementation for all those modules of the ERP system which principally enable the grants, procurement, accounts payable, accounts receivable, leases, loans, and general ledger functionalities. In addition, they work closely with organizations across the Conservancy to organize interdepartmental needs for the effective functioning of all those modules which principally enable the grants, procurement, accounts payable, accounts receivable, leases, loans, and general ledger functionalities in coordination with the ERP project managers.

Responsibilities & Scope

Facilitate and coordinates with the ERP Project Managers and the ERP Program Manager the implementation of all financial modules and aspects of the ERP system for finance, including procurement and grants.
Explain accounting and finance requirements to all stakeholders and how they will impact the design and implementation of the finance pieces of the ERP, including interfaces with the HR modules and current systems in place.
Understanding of accounting and finance requirements and impact on systems.
Take a collaborative, best-practice approach to problem-solving, design, and configuration.
Responsible for developing and maintaining resource plans and testing strategies specific to the finance modules in conjunction with the ERP Project Managers and the ERP Program Manager.
Coordinate with the Change Management function to ensure timely and effective delivery of change management-related communications and training.
Ensure TNC policies, procedures, financial standards, and legal requirements are met and managed for ethical compliance.
Presents and reports to the Controller and the ERP Program Manager on functional activities.
Coordinate with directors/ sponsors on critical decisions, risks, and issues.
Work closely with other leads and the ERP Program Manager to align on cross-functional decisions and impacts.
Responsible for developing and proposing configuration, reporting, and integrations in coordination with the ERP Program Manager and ERP Project Managers.
Eliminate "roadblocks," facilitates resolution, makes micro-decisions guiding BAs, SMEs, etc., for finance-related ERP issues in coordination with the ERP Program Manager and ERP Project Managers.
Ensure correct resources are engaged for decision-making/ input for finance-related ERP issues.
Own and communicate product vision for the Core Financial functions and define, recommend, prioritize, and implement solutions aligning with TNC's strategic goals for finance-related ERP issues in coordination with the ERP Program Manager and ERP Project Managers.
Identify product and release requirements for finance-related ERP issues and communicate them to the ERP Program Manager and ERP Project Managers for resolution.
Balance and communicate priorities between strategic new development against ongoing production support for finance-related ERP issues.
Coordinate and lead testing efforts for finance-related ERP functionalities while contributing to the employee experience with end-user focus, collaboration, and transparency.
Recognize available options and select the appropriate course of action for continuous improvement of solutions and delivery processes with the highest business value for finance-related ERP issues in coordination with the ERP Program Manager and ERP Project Managers
Proactively identify, resolve, or bring up issues, concerns, and impediments for finance-related ERP functions in coordination with the ERP Program Manager and ERP Project Managers to develop the project efficiently and effectively.
Some travel may be required.
Ensure the programmatic work is collaborative and well-integrated across organization.
Assist with development of a budget and works within a budget.
Decisions may bind organization financially and legally.
May supervise professional and/or administrative staff and oversees day-to-day work.
Reinforce consistency in the organization's policies and procedures and provides support related to relevant field.
May manage or participate in complex negotiations.
Report to leadership on activities.
WE'RE LOOKING FOR YOU



Are you looking for work you can believe in? At TNC we strive to embody a philosophy of Work that You Can Believe in where you can feel like you are making a difference every day. We’re looking for someone with strong experience in leading a diverse, multi-disciplinary team.

The ideal candidate should have exceptional communication and collaboration skills and experience in management of data and personnel. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the ongoing mission of conservation by directing and shaping the work of our team!



WHAT YOU'LL BRING
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or related field and 7 years related work experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience designing, implementing, and directing multiple complex projects.
Experience effectively communicating with Senior Management via presentations, direct communications, and documentation.
Experience using project management techniques and tools, including the Microsoft Office suite/Project and SmartSheet.
Experience managing the schedule and financial aspects of large, highly complex projects.
Experience with GAAP and not-for-profit accounting principles, practices, and regulations, including government grants accounting and reporting.
Experience with multi-currency and consolidations.
Experience working with global organizations and across different cultures.
Experience recruiting, supervising and developing staff.


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Business analysis or product owner experience, preferably within the realm of Enterprise Performance Management.
Critical thinker with demonstrated problem-solving skills.
Multi-lingual skills and multi-cultural cross-cultural experience
Experience in leading effective teams.
Experience with government grants, cooperative agreements, contract requirements, and related accounting and reporting.
Experience implementing or managing financial systems, including Workday.
Experience with source-to-pay (S2P) and vendor management best practices.
Finance background or experience running Finance programs/projects.
Supervisory skills are a plus.
Current PMP Certification is strongly preferred.
Demonstrated ability to support highly complex, large-scale projects or multiple medium-scale projects in a large, decentralized organization.
Demonstrated success in analyzing, manipulating and interpreting data, and developing, reporting and implementing solutions.
Service oriented. Courteous, personable, tactful and experienced dealing effectively with all levels of staff.
WHAT WE BRING



Since 1951, TNC has been doing work you can believe in. Through grassroots action, we have grown from a small non-profit into one of the most effective and wide-reaching environmental organizations in the world. Thanks to more than 1 million members, over 400 scientists, and the dedicated efforts of our diverse staff and partners, we impact conservation around the world!

Job Title: Manager, Product Management: Concierge Travel - Velocity Black (Remote - Eligible)
Job Description:
Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Manager, Product Management: Concierge Travel - Velocity Black (Remote - Eligible)

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We’re excited to share that Capital One US has now acquired Velocity Black, a digital concierge company. Take a look at the announcement here.

Velocity Black by Capital One harnesses the power of artificial intelligence, the warmth of human experts and the convenience of the latest interfaces to help high-performance people actualize the full potential of their lives. It's concierge, reimagined for the digital age.

By harnessing 24/7 chat, AI, and mobile payments, we help our customers do more and be more in the digital age. From access to the hottest restaurants to guaranteed upgrades at the world’s finest resorts. Make a custom request through the app and you will be chatting to our team within 1 minute, 24/7/365.

We are looking for someone passionate about hospitality and the customer experience to work on our Velocity Black Concierge product. You will have the opportunity to work on customer facing and internal products, and be asked to coordinate between stakeholders, engineering, and leadership to build a world class product.

In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Leads

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on sales, service, and customer engagement are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

As a Velocity Black Concierge product manager, you will:

Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external partners to grow and enhance Velocity Black’s luxury concierge offering. You will work closely with operations, sales, engineering, and leadership to create a premium experience that exceeds customer expectations.

Dream up and deliver new luxury concierge features and experiences in partnership with business partners. You will be responsible for optimizing in-market products though rapid testing and obsessing over the customer experience.

Think strategically to prioritize the roadmap in a way that balances multiple priorities including building a product that customers love, meeting the interests of internal partners, and driving value for our growing luxury concierge business.

Shape the product development roadmap for new launches and features.

Work alongside a passionate and collaborative team to create innovative new concierge experiences.

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focused. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

5+ years of experience in Agile Product Management

Experience in ecommerce or travel technology in a technical, product, or strategic role

Experience working with and building high-end luxury products

Understanding of end-to-end online travel agency or ecommerce workflows from shopping through servicing

Spikes in a design or customer-centric skill set and is obsessed with the customer

Experience working with and building high-end luxury products

Passionate about customer experience and hungry to go above and beyond to ship features and build a world-class product

Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity

Job Description:

Develops, maintains, and automates metrics to assess USCYBERCOM operational Measure of Effective and Performance (MOE/MOP)
Develops cost-benefit analysis, data collection, data analysis, risk analysis, simulation model execution, economic analysis, and operational effectiveness studies.
Devises modeling and measuring techniques, and utilizes mathematics, statistical methods, engineering methods, operational mathematics techniques (linear programming, game theory, probability theory, symbolic language, etc.) and other principles and laws of scientific and economic disciplines to investigate complex issues, identify, and solve problems, and aid better decision making.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):

Proficient in using query languages (e.g., SQL, Hive, Pig). Experience with common data science toolkits (e.g., R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc.) Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., D3.js, GGplot, etc.).
Provides operations research analysis support for intelligence, cyberspace operations, contingency operations, and operational-level planning, joint and multilateral training exercises, and strategic engagement policy.
Researches and collects information from various sources and analyzes it for better understanding of cyberspace operations assessment frameworks and methodologies.
Interprets policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and objectives and applies operations research principles and techniques to compound analytic needs.
Identifies issues and priorities affecting assessment of planned or on-going cyberspace operations.
Selects features, builds and optimizes classifiers using machine learning techniques.
Enhances data collection procedures to include information relevant for building analytic systems.
Analyzes, reports, and develops recommendations on data related to compound operational metrics.
Assists in identifying and prioritizing requirements for capability development efforts.
Applies and/or develops highly advanced technologies, scientific principles, theories, and concepts to assist organizations in advancing performance and operating more efficiently.
Assists in addressing requirements and the evaluation of data assessment strategies: sampling, statistical analysis, evaluation, flow processing, and management assessment strategies.
Possesses an in-depth understanding of cyberspace doctrine, policies, operations, and organizations.
Collaborates with internal and external partners to facilitate cyberspace operations assessment, situational awareness, and information sharing.
Delivers innovative, flexible, integrated solutions to meet changing business needs.
Assists in the planning of programs and recommends technological application programs to accomplish long-range objectives.
Exhibits an intermediate degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness during the conduct of research and development and preparation of documents, briefings, and analyses which may include narrative, tabular, and graphic materials.

Qualifications:

Minimum five years of operations research analyst experience is required.
Minimum of bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Operations Research, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Computer Engineering, or related discipline.

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus

InnovaSystems is seeking a senior level BSA-SME with the ability to perform exceptional data analysis and detailed requirements building supporting United States Space Force readiness reporting objectives for FY23 and beyond. Ability to train readiness at multiple levels: leadership, MAJCOMs, Wings, Unit Commanders, Unit Admins, etc.
Ability to communicate with customers, stakeholders, and an agile software development team
Proficiency in MS Office Suite a must
Strong organizational, time management, and meeting facilitation skills

Skills Desired

Knowledge of METL/SORTS readiness reporting policy
Expertise in current readiness reporting (to include UTC reporting) efforts strongly recommended

Product Manager, Enterprise Entitlements

Product Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you


In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

Enterprise Entitlements platform enforces proper access to data (via APIs) based on customer and account status. We sit at the very fun intersection of customer servicing experiences & complex technology at scale, giving our team a lens into much of what’s going on at Capital One. If you are excited about finding insights in large datasets, care deeply about helping our customers to solve their (and their customers’) problems, and enjoys learning quickly and often - this is the role for you!

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

At least 2 years of experience in Agile product management

Introduction
Are you looking for a career that will allow you to use your unique blend of business acumen and tech savvy? Business Analysts at IBM are subject matter experts that build the bridge between our business and our clients, immersing themselves into the market to understand problems and find innovative solutions. Be ready to navigate the complex relationships that make the business world run and find the actionable insights that result in great business decisions.

Your Role and Responsibilities


Octo, an IBM company, is an industry-leading, award-winning provider of technical solutions for the federal government. At Octo, we specialize in providing agile software engineering, user experience design, cloud services, and digital strategy services that address government's most pressing missions. Octo delivers intelligent solutions and rapid results, yielding lower costs and measurable outcomes.

Our team is what makes Octo great. At Octo you'll work beside some of the smartest and most accomplished staff you'll find in your career. Octo offers fantastic benefits and an amazing workplace culture where you will feel valued while you perform mission critical work for our government. Voted one of the region’s best places to work multiple times, Octo is an employer of choice!

You…

As a Business Systems Analyst you are responsible for understanding the business objectives, soliciting business requirements, cataloging technical functionality and data processing, and updating project/process documentation. You are also responsible for conducting knowledge transfer of captured requirements to development teams and serve as the SME/Product Owner for assigned functional areas. You will assist our Federal Customer to define system scope and objectives based on user needs and help solve complex problems considering the existing application functionality, capacity, and limitations.

Us…

We were founded as a fresh alternative in the Government Consulting Community and are dedicated to the belief that results are a product of analytical thinking, agile design principles and that solutions are built in collaboration with, not for, our customers. This mantra drives us to succeed and act as true partners in advancing our client’s missions.

Program Mission…

The project you will be working is to modernize an existing legacy mainframe application to an AWS cloud based, serverless environment supporting forward leaning cloud architectures, reduce program sustainment costs, and increase system reliability. Our approach is to transform legacy applications to be cloud native and reside in a VPC as a Service (VPCaaS). Additionally, modernize current applications by breaking them down into loosely coupled micro-services, and leveraging a continuous integration / continuous delivery pipeline to enable an agile DevOps Strategy.


Years of Experience: 5+ years of experience or more

Education: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science/Information Systems/ Engineering or related field.

Location: Reston, VA or Remote

Clearance: Ability to obtain Public Trust








Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Creates and captures Agile artifacts like epics and user stories within Jira and Confluence by working to translate technical requirements through coordination with the development team and Product Owner
Analyzes business process flows to develop activity models and detailed requirements.
Documents discussions during facilitated sessions to capture information.
Facilitates requirements elicitation sessions and one-on-one interviews with all levels of personnel and all levels of technical understanding.
Provides analytical expertise to capture stakeholder business needs, goals and objectives, and features and functions.
Experience reviewing existing system documentation like DASDLs, Interface Control Documents, System Specification Documentation, and using that source to define new system requirements.
Clearance: Ability to obtain Public Trust

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience working in agile environments and is comfortable working closely with a variety of team members (Developers, Testers, Scrum Master, etc.)
Effective communication skills that support requirements solicitation and accurate depiction of requirements in tracking systems like JIRA.
Highly organized and detailed oriented.
Ability to quickly adapt and understand existing program scope or assist the government with identification and documentation of intended scope where needed.
Use analytical and critical thinking to translate the government’s requirements distinctly.
Ability to understand and translate technical solutions as needed as this program is highly technical in nature.
Understand and experience with common requirement capture techniques like process modeling, brainstorming, SWOT analysis, “The 5 Whys”, etc.
UI/UX and user interface wireframing experience is a plus.
Knowledge of the AWS Cloud and possess an AWS Cloud Practitioner certification is a plus.

About Business Unit
IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM
In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?


About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - People Strategy & Analytics
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Business Analyst - People Strategy & Analytics

People Strategy & Analytics is an emerging field where Capital One is on the leading front. Our team brings data, analytics, and insights to shape critical talent decisions and strategy at Capital One. We work closely with HR partners and senior executives in shaping talent policy, automating real-time data and improving talent decision-making. The team is comprised of people with diverse skills and backgrounds including: data analysts and engineers, product managers, data scientists, consultants and strategists, business analysts, HR specialists, economists, and Industrial Organizational Psychologists.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to solve open-ended, complex questions about how we should attract, develop, and retain top talent. You will team up with world-class professionals and senior leadership and work on impactful projects. Your day-to-day might involve:

Using data to help executives set ambitious but achievable diversity goals

Building models to predict attrition, and testing new retention strategies

Designing new ways to understand and measure associate potential

Developing analyses and tools to help Capital One source and hire the best talent

…and you will do it all in a collaborative environment that promotes continuous learning, rewards innovation, and prioritizes your development.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Strategic problem solving: Identify high impact opportunities to transform the associate experience, conduct analysis, and share insights that inform solutions

Design: Drive and build key programs and analytics solutions for our partners, including measurement strategy, attribution modeling, and automated insights

Experimentation: Partner with clients in experiment design to better understand key drivers of associate behavior

Insights & analysis: Analyze the impact of our programs and combine those insights with the latest thinking in organizational science to help our clients make data-driven, informed decisions

Successful Team Members Demonstrate Competencies In These Areas

Purpose: You feel a deep personal connection to improving the associate experience and are motivated by applying advanced analytics in a mission-driven way

Analytical thinking: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation. Identify opportunities for improvement and use data to make strategic and tactical recommendations

Execution: Develop and test hypotheses, design solutions, assess operational feasibility, support implementation efforts, and develop plans and tools for monitoring outcomes

Partnership: Collaborate effectively with other team members and clients in HR

Communication: Strong written and oral communication skills, including visualization skills (i.e., able to “tell the story” and highlight key insights in a clear and concise manner that is easily understood by stakeholders)

Results focus: Drives for results and achieves important goals applying strong organizational skills and detail orientation, even amidst ambiguity

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering)

At least 1 year of experience in analysis

Preferred Qualifications:

Master’s Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering

1+ years of experience in Statistical model building

1+ years of experience in market research

1+ years of experience in SQL querying

2+ years of experience in business analysis

1+ years of experience in consulting

Operations Research Analyst - Hybrid - Onsite T. W. Th; Remote M/F
Location: Pentagon
DoD Clearance Required

Job Description:

KeyLogic is seeking an experienced Operations Research Analyst who can lead and provide technical services supporting the G-6 in the areas of planning, programming, and analytical services to ensure that critical Army C4IT/CA needs are resourced and integrated across Army programs. The Analyst shall provide quantitative and qualitative analytical services to the G-6 in support of its mission and assist in the development of the Army G-6 C4IT/CA plans. The Analyst must also provide expertise in the areas of Army Staff operations, Program Objective Memorandum cycle, Army Data Warehouse database, DoD Financial Management policies and procedures, the Congressional Budget Process, DoD Program Review, and all related policies, laws, and governance.

Required Qualifications:

Minimum 6-7 years of experience managing complex IT projects / operations / systems /applications of a nature similar in size and scope as referenced under this TO.
Ability to provide support for PPBE events to include assistance in formulating and writing resource management guidance for C4IT/CA, HQDA and OSD data calls.
Experience in reviewing and drafting recommendations when presented with Government strategies
Ability to coordinate both resource and administrative MDEP change information per PPBE processes to update the cPROBE/Data Warehouse database as approved by the G-6.
Expert in creating Microsoft EXCEL pivot tables, functions and formulas to analyze data.
Experience in review, coordination, processes and validating requirements.
Experience in working independently and with limited government supervision.
Expert in creating presentations that are grammatically correct in spelling and sentence structure.
Ability to support for the development of key Information Technology resource presentations for G-6 and HQDA senior leaders.
Provide support to research, analyze data and information and report on Army C4IT/Cyber requirements, and programming.
Provide support to research, analyze data and information, and produce the Army’s C4IT/CA budget submission (IT/CA Exhibits).
Provide data visualization expertise, which includes a practical working knowledge of Power BI and Tableau.


Desired Qualifications:

5-6 plus years’ experience in leading multiple complex tasks and high impact assignments and acquired knowledge, skills, and abilities to determine innovative solutions to complex requirements.
Coordinate, analyze and track Army IT Overseas Contingency Operation (OCO) and unfunded requirements (UFR) in support of the PPBE process.
Ability to conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis to support the integration of Army IT and Cyber requirements within related Management Decision Packages (MDEPs) in support of the PPBE process.
Provide support for resource requests from the Office of the President, the Congress, OSD, SECARMY, and the CSA.
Provide support by translating law, policy or guidance, as applicable, from Congress, OMB, DoD and Army into actionable guidance as it relates to the Department of Defense Planning, PPBE.
Possess exceptional customer service skills.
Possess strong time-management and prioritization skills.
Possess strong written and oral communication skills in the English language, and at a minimum, ability to read, write, speak and understand English.
Possess the ability to communicate applicable technical subject matter expertise to management and others.
Ability to perform all aspects of assigned roles, conduct problem solving, conduct coordination, and provide updates with minimal coaching or training from the government.

Required Clearance: DoD Secret

At KeyLogic we recognize that our employees are our most valuable resources. We hire talented, qualified professionals and provide each of our employees with every resource and opportunity to excel in their day-to-day activities as well as advance their career.

KeyLogic is a highly successful provider of professional and engineering services. We specialize in solutions that enable our customers to make better decisions for their organization. KeyLogic’s performance has earned the company a solid reputation for high standards, proactive solutions, and an outstanding commitment to the customer, best exemplified by the fact we have never had a one-time federal customer — all of our customers have provided repeat business. This has led us to achieve significant growth every year since our founding in 1999.

At KeyLogic, we're known for our extraordinary commitment to the success of the organizations we serve. Our client list includes the Department of Defense (DoD), Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Energy (DOE), Transportation (DOT) and Treasury (including the Internal Revenue Service (IRS)), General Services Administration (GSA), and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).

Job Code:
2019

Complete Description:

CFSA is looking for analysts to support the implementation of a new child welfare information system. The selected individuals will be part of a team that will work closely with social workers, and software engineers to develop scenarios to test the new system. The analysts will be trained in business operations and Microsoft Dynamics customer relation management solution. The analysts will plan activities, follow-up, schedule meetings, conduct testing, document results, address blockers and raise concerns. The person would support development of the knowledge of our agency, and the common causes of data quality issues. This position will need to in the CFSA location minimally 3-days a week.

Responsibilities:

Conducts regular and comprehensive testing; analyzes, provides, and communicates the recommendations to improve the Child Welfare Information System business operations and improve application efficiency; and develops testing manual including detailed processes and steps.
Analyzes, evaluates, and recommends course of actions to improve the efficiency of program or system operations.
Analyses policies and procedures for work functions, determines what needs to be tested, and develops step by step testing process that will be carried out by self and/or others.
Reviews the requirements and user feedback from business users to determine best testing scenarios and parameters.
Works closely with end users to design and support the development of automated testing processes to ensure high-quality application delivery for business users.
Develops data by entering client information, investigation results, and case information to be used for testing software applications and interfaces.
Communicates through Microsoft Word, Excel and/or other tools the results of running the tests and recommends changes to improve application efficiency.
Creates and maintains online requirements, testing scenarios, and develops reports indicating result of tests.
Collaborates on problem resolutions, team decisions, and project planning.
Participates in innovation (i.e., Research and Development or its equivalent) lab to prototype and build minimum viable products/services, promote customer friendly technology services, and build resource capacity.
Execute all the test case and report defects, define severity, and priority for each defect
Proactively performs end to end testing to ensure that the updated systems and software are operating at the optimal level and as planned.
Creates internal user guides for publishing on help platform. Maintains documentation and runbooks as features and tools change.
Collects feedback from users and internal partners about how to improve training materials or methods to achieve the optimal results.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: From $35.00 per hour

Experience level:

6 years

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Washington, DC 20003: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

user story and acceptance criteria developmen: 6 years (Required)
documentation of testing results: 6 years (Required)
Business analyst: 2 years (Required)

MS OFFICE/POWERPOINT/EXCEL: 4 years (Required)
testing end to end software applications: 2 years (Required)

need pervious work experience with DC CFSA: 1 year (Required)
