Employment Conditions.

Qualifications
Qualifying experience may be obtained in the private or public sector. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g. Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic, religious spiritual; community; student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Additional qualifications information can be found here.
GS-13
To qualify, applicants must have completed at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-12 grade level or above in the Federal service. Specialized experience is defined as experience creating management reports and analyses; developing applications using Oracle Application Express (APEX), Visual Basics for Applications (VBA), or Microsoft Power Platform (MPP); and completing data and statistical analyses by writing queries and creating reports using Tableau, WebFocus, or other reporting tools.
GS-14
To qualify, applicants must have completed at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-13 grade level or above in the Federal service. Specialized experience is defined as experience querying financial regulatory data to create management reports and analyses; developing and implementing business change requirements to multiple Oracle Application Express (APEX) applications using custom PL/SQL processes, stored procedures, and functions; designing the underlying databases by creating tables, indexes, and triggers; developing and maintaining VBA and MPP applications; completing data and statistical analyses by writing queries using Analytic Functions and creating reports using Tableau, WebFocus, or other reporting tools.

How You Will Be Evaluated

You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.

Your resume and the online assessment questionnaire will be reviewed to determine whether you meet the qualification requirements outlined in this announcement. Therefore, it is imperative that your resume contain sufficiently detailed information upon which to make the qualification determination. Please ensure that your resume contains specific information such as position titles, beginning and ending dates of employment for each position, average number of hours worked per week, and if the position is/was in the Federal government, you should provide the position series and grade level.

Your resume will also be evaluated to measure your responses to the assessment questions. If you rated yourself higher on the questionnaire than what is supported by your resume, your overall qualifications assessment may be adversely affected.

If you are found qualified, you will be placed in one of three categories: Best Qualified, Highly Qualified, or Qualified. These category assignments are a measure of the degree in which your background and responses to the assessment questions match the competencies/knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSAs) listed below. Within these categories, candidates eligible for veterans’ preference will receive selection priority over non-veterans.

Knowledge of business intelligence reporting systems t using Oracle Application Express (APEX), WebFOCUS, PL/SQL, Visual Basic for Applications, Microsoft Power Platform, or other standard programming languages/development tools.
Ability to analyze data and write queries.
Ability to analyze platform and software problems to make recommendations in order to solve operational and systems problems.
Ability to create and maintain web-based systems and reports using HTML, CSS, and Javascript.
Ability to communicate orally.
Ability to communicate in writing.
Knowledge of systems development techniques for all phases of the project management life cycle, system development life cycle, and agile implementation frameworks.
Knowledge of data modeling, data mart design, relational database, and enterprise data architecture concepts.

You do not need to respond separately to these KSAs. Your answers to the online questionnaire and resume will serve as responses to the KSAs.

Job Title: Foreign Service Limited Position Opportunity- FSL-0301-02
Job Description:
Duties and Responsibilities: The Private Enterprise Officer will serve as a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Product Manager in the PSE Hub. This position plays a key role in supporting the Agency's approach to create the institutional conditions, operating infrastructure, and capacity necessary to expand engagement with the private sector in the United States and partner countries.

The incumbent will serve as the business-owner product, compliance, and system manager for Campfire, USAID’s new enterprise-wide CRM platform for private sector and philanthropic partners.

As the Private Enterprise Officer, you will:

Maintain knowledge of M/CIO and Federal Government-wide policies and good practices related to incident response, user experience and user interface, strategic management of Authorizations to Operate (ATOs);
Coordinate with M/CIO and USAID Helpdesk to provide timely response to non-technical questions and requests from users, such as those pertaining to data or the use of system features;
Serve as System Owner for system of records notice (SORN) related to Campfire data collections, and works with M/CIO to update and maintain SORN as necessary;
Serve as internal CRM thought and practice leader, and represents USAID within various Federal Government-wide communities of practice related to Salesforce, enterprise CRM, and others as appropriate; and
Develop, manage, and maintain regular channels for gathering feedback from frontline users, and coordinate with M/CIO to prioritize requests for new features, functionalities, and system enhancements based on user input.

Qualifications: To qualify for the position of Private Enterprise Officer FL-0301-02, you must possess the required specialized experience specific to the series and grade you are applying to.

Specialized Experience: For the FL-02, you must have one year of specialized experience at the FL-03 (GS-13) grade level or equivalent. Specialized experience is defined as:

Serving as principal system compliance lead and business analyst, collecting, managing, and reporting on key system value and performance metrics, including user satisfaction, data value, and more;
Overseeing continuous monitoring of Campfire data and documentation for engagements and strategic external partner relationships to ensure completeness, compliance, and value for users and the Agency;
Developing policies, procedures, and operating procedures as needed to incentivize, reinforce, and, where appropriate, mandate system use and compliance by key user groups around the Agency; and
Manages system and future system enhancements in accordance with M/CIO and federal government standards for: accessibility and Section 508 compliance; cyber security; information assurance and privacy; and more. Ensures rigorous adherence to USAID policies regarding the protection of personally identifiable information and data security.

Qualifications:

Must be a U.S. citizen;
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance; and
Hands-on enterprise CRM experience in a business analyst and/or product/system manager role (Salesforce proficiency is highly preferred but not required).

Interested candidates should submit the following:

Resume/CV (candidates must include month, year and the number of hours worked per week for each position listed);
A short written statement of interest;
Documentation if claiming Veterans Preference (DD-214, Service Disability Letter, Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty, etc.); and
Documentation if serving as a current/former political appointee (SF-50s, appointment letter, etc.).

Please submit your application package to DDIFSLJobs@usaid.gov. Please use the subject line: “FSL APPLICATION PACKAGE: Announcement No. IPI_56/30691 Private Enterprise Officer- FSL-02-IPI/PRIVATE SECTOR ENGAGEMENT HUB." Application submissions are required by 11:59 p.m. EST, November 28, 2023. Packages not submitted by the deadline with the specified subject line—or incomplete packages—will not receive consideration. This notice may be used to fill additional vacancies, as the workforce needs of the Bureau may change.

We seek to elevate and include the voices of the USAID workforce, recognizing and valuing the unique contributions of all stakeholders. CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.
Skills and attributes for success:
Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders.
Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes.
Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships

Qualifications:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users.
Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently.
Must possess exceptional attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills

Ideally, you will also have:
Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)

At MetaPhase, we believe Quirky is Cool and being authentic is the only way to be! We take the work we do very seriously and do a lot of important mission-focused work for our clients. We are individuals with different passions and strengths who take as much joy in the work we do as from those we work with. Be the difference and make it happen?




Role Summary

MetaPhase is seeking a Cyber Security Strategist with 10 or more (10+) years of experience to be a part of a federal customer engagement team supporting cybersecurity strategy, business requirements and analysis, and process improvement. This team will work closely with senior federal leadership to distill national cyber security mission requirements, identify gaps in current services, and draft strategic documents outlining future activities, ensuring they closely align with national cyber security plans. This position is not technical in nature, but rather requires an ability to work well with senior leaders, understand the current cybersecurity policy and plan landscape, and draft detailed strategic documents.


What You Will Be Doing

Work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate external business requirements into internal ones.
Identify and solve the core business need, turning vague or aspirational business requirements into clear and concise strategic requirements.
Conduct reviews of current activities to identify gaps between current activities and other requirements.
Draft divisional strategic plans, ensuring alignment to other agency and national cyber security plans.
Be self-motivated, detail oriented, and highly organized.
Leverage skills in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Apply strong communication skills to build relationships, connect people, and support team members.
Own and lead communications between internal and external stakeholders as needed.




What We Need From You (Required)

Minimum of 10 or more (10+) years’ experience in communications, business analysis or role that involves writing, speaking, coordination and 5 + of more years of experience in a leadership or management capacity.
At least one related industry certification (i.e., Project/Program Management Professional (PMP), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP))
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience in cyber security policy, organizational change management, roadmaps, and AOP development and implementation.
Possess strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
U.S. citizenship required (no exceptions)

Bonus Points (Desired)

Federal consulting experience; Experience at DHS a strong plus
Security Clearance (Existing Top Secret Clearance preferred)



Travel

None


Work Location

Washington, D.C. (Currently remote)


Education Level

Minimum bachelor’s degree (master’s highly preferred)


Clearance Level

Ability to obtain and hold an active Top Secret Clearance

Job Title: Call for CVs - Operations Research Analysts
Job Description:
Dexis is a professional services firm that solves the most pressing social challenges in complex environments, paving the way for a more secure and prosperous world.

Dexis embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion and strives to build and maintain a safe environment where we celebrate diverse backgrounds, treat everyone with respect, and value the unique lived experiences each person brings based on their race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, military or veteran status, national origin, age, marital status or family status and related conditions.

At Dexis, you will experience a corporate culture of inclusiveness, fairness, and trust. You will be given the means and mentorship needed to succeed, and your creativity will be rewarded.

Background and Scope of Work:

The Institute for Security Governance (ISG), an organizational entity of the Defense Security Cooperation University (DSCU) within the Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA), will be collaborating with the Defense Institute of International Studies (DIILS) in planning for, and implementing, institutional capacity building (ICB) engagements with emerging partner nations in the pursuit of mutually agreed-upon institutional capacity building objectives related to defense legal topics/themes.

These security cooperation engagements will typically be for short-term technical assistance, with the focus for each engagement being tailored to the needs of the country and to mutually agreed upon objectives.

Dexis is currently calling for CVs and resumes of interested Subject Matter Experts and consultants with expertise in common topics/themes for these engagements, which may include:

Military Law Organizational Development and Relationships
Principles, Practices, Processes, and Standards in Military Justice Codes
Policy Development for Legal Systems
Operational Law (Role of legal review and advice in planning and executing operations)
International Humanitarian Law
Law of Armed Conflict
International Peacekeeping Law
Acquisition Law
Defense/Military Coordination with Legislative/Parliamentary Efforts
Legal Aspects of Defense Support to Civil Authorities
Military Law Jurisdiction vs. Civil Jurisdiction
Professional Education and Development for Defense Legal Personnel
Maritime Law Enforcement

Consultants/SMEs will draft, develop, and/or contribute to deliverables that may be completed or finalized by contractor or government personnel. Deliverables may include:

Study Reports
ICB Engagement Support Materials
Ad hoc Papers, Reports, Planning Documents
After Action Reviews
Meetings / Calls
Trip Reports

Travel will be required during these short-term engagements, possible destinations include:

Afghanistan, Argentina, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bosnia in Herzegovina, Cameroon, Chad, Chile, Colombia, Croatia, Djibouti, Georgia, Ghana, Guatemala, Guyana, Montenegro, Indonesia, Nepal, Iraq, Niger, Jordan, Nigeria, Kazakhstan, Qatar, Kenya, Saudi Arabia, Kosovo, Serbia, Liberia, Tajikistan, Lebanon, Thailand,

Macedonia, Trinidad and Tobago, Malaysia, Tunisia, Uganda, Mali, Uganda, Moldova, Ukraine, Mongolia, Uzbekistan.




Tasks and Responsibilities:

Operations Research Analysts' responsibilities may include:

Formulate and apply mathematical modeling and other optimizing methods to develop and interpret information that assists management with decision making, policy formulation, or other managerial functions.
May collect and analyze data and develop decision support software, service, or products.
May develop and supply optimal time, cost, or logistics networks for program evaluation, review, or implementation.
Using statistical analysis or simulations to analyze the information to define operational problems, develop methods to analyze the problem, and develop practical solutions.
Defining data requirements, gathering and validating information, and applying judgment and statistical tests to devise problem-solving actions.
Developing mathematical models of potential and existing operational problems.
Advising leadership teams on solutions and assisting with decision making.
Producing high-quality reports on findings and recommendations.
Developing time and cost networks to plan, control, and review large projects.
Developing business methods and procedures, such as accounting systems, logistics systems, and production schedules.

Job Title: Mgr- Franchise Performance - Washington D.C/ Minneapolis, MN
Job Description:
We are Subway Headquarters! A dedicated team of professionals supporting thousands of franchisees around the globe.

Hungry for a fresh, new career? Look no further because one of the world’s most iconic brands can help you get there.
We are looking for Manager, Franchise Performance to support one of the following territories: Washington, DC / Minneapolis, MN / Salt Lake City, UT

**This role will travel overnight fulltime in the early stages and will transition into less travel after a determined amount of time.**

The Manager, Franchise Performance will provide strategic business direction and alignment in order to influence Subway franchise owners in maximizing profitability of their portfolio and help to align store operating procedures to Subway's brand standards. This role will communicate the expected performance level of the locations and franchisees within their assigned area in relation to the company's KPIs and metrics. They will implement business growth by identifying potential operational opportunities for improvement and provide training to strengthen locations.

Position responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Provide operational and food safety guidance and education during restaurant visits: Consistently evaluate SUBWAY restaurants using the PBE model on quarterly basis.
Document adherence to Company compliance standards, improvements made, areas of opportunity and direction on how to improve, if needed during coaching sessions.
Evaluate how the restaurant is performing compared to SUBWAY policies and procedures, analyze sales and cost data and provide specific customized direction to improve in these areas.
Review franchisees portfolio and have regularly scheduled business reviews to see growth potential and areas of opportunity.
Coach and counsel franchisees to reach individual store and territory goals.
Provide guidance to franchisees to grow their business both within the local community in store and though online sales and delivery.
Build Territory Relations by visiting all assigned restaurants at least quarterly depending on performance level, communicating with franchisees via voicemail, e-mail, territory meetings, individual franchise meetings and written communications.
Gains respect from franchisees to be recognized as an asset to the business and leader in the field.
Assist Territory Director and shared services team with site reviews by conducting three day parts of customer intercepts for all reviews within assigned area
Provide direction and proficiency to franchisees and staff with regard to New Store Openings & Transfer Training Hours
The successful candidate will have:

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Communications, Business Analysis or related field preferred.
3+ years of restaurant experience preferred.
The ability to learn technology initiatives and cascade this knowledge to others.
Excellent written and verbal communication,
Ability to problem solve and business analysis skills.
High degree of detail orientation and ability to work within a team, hands on approach during in restaurant visits.
Must also be able to work autonomously and be professional.
AA/EOE/M/F/D/V

The Company is only considering applicants who are currently authorized to work in the country the position is based. AA/EOE/M/F/D/V

Job Title: Air Force UoT Business Analyst - Senior
Job Description:
Overview:
Advana is a multi-domain technology platform which offers military and business decision makers, analysts, and users at all levels unprecedented access to authoritative enterprise data and structured analytics in a scalable, reliable, and secure environment. It offers platform-, data analytics-, and data science-as-a-service tools to complete analysis and data exploration and data visualization capabilities. Using one central data platform with right-time data, data tools, and other self-service products, the goal of Advana is to simplify solutions and put the power of analytics in the pocket of every analyst and decision-making authority within the DOD.

Since 2006, Intelligent Waves has delivered mission-focused multi-domain operational expertise and innovation to the Government through high-impact technology solutions in cybersecurity, data science, enterprise network engineering, software development, and platform mission support. Anytime. Anywhere. Any domain.


Location & Travel: The Air Force UoT Business Analyst – Senior position will be a Hybrid role based in the DC Metro Area with the ability to be in the office 1 day/week and attend onsite meetings as needed.

Security Clearance: The Air Force UoT Business Analyst – Senior must be a United States Citizen and hold a current Interim Secret security clearance.

Mission - ADVANA

Employees are required to follow all company and customer site COVID-19 protocols.
Responsibilities:
Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with stakeholders, including Air Force personnel and academic staff, to understand their needs, objectives, and problems. Elicit and document detailed business requirements.
Process Mapping: Create process maps, flowcharts, and diagrams to illustrate current and future workflows, identifying bottlenecks, redundancies, and areas for improvement.
Data Analysis: Analyze data related to business processes, operations, and performance to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
Solution Design: Develop and propose solutions, including business process improvements, system enhancements, and technology solutions to address identified business challenges and opportunities.
Documentation: Prepare comprehensive documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, use cases, and user stories.
Project Management: Assist in project management tasks, including project planning, tracking, and reporting on project status to ensure successful implementation of business solutions.
Quality Assurance: Ensure that proposed solutions meet quality standards and align with the strategic goals of the Air Force UoT.
Stakeholder Communication: Maintain open and effective communication with stakeholders, keeping them informed of project progress and addressing their concerns and feedback.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users and staff members to ensure the successful adoption and implementation of new processes and systems.
Change Management: Help manage the change process by facilitating smooth transitions and addressing resistance to change among employees.
Continuous Improvement: Continuously monitor and evaluate implemented solutions, gathering feedback and making adjustments as needed to optimize performance and efficiency.
Risk Management: Identify potential risks and issues related to business changes and work proactively to mitigate them.
Qualifications:
Qualifications and Skills:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field.
Five years of experience in business analysis, with a focus on process improvement and system implementation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques.
Knowledge of project management methodologies.
Understanding of Air Force policies, procedures, and regulations (preferred).
Relevant certifications such as Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Professional (PMP) may be beneficial.

Job Title: Associate Principal Business Analyst, Transparency Services
Job Description:
The Associate Principal Business Analyst position is responsible for collaborating with senior business analysts on gathering, drafting, and creating requirements for developers, as well as drafting procedures, user guides, technical specifications and related coding guidance, in addition to testing and production support. The Associate Principal Business Analyst works in conjunction with the senior analysts to ensure that system users are trained on new applications and enhancements, and to support the various applications within Transparency Services that are used in collecting reference data, as well as both real-time and post market surveillance. The Associate Principal Business Analyst is required to apply a basic understanding of securities industry processing including a working knowledge of FINRA member firm’s order and trade reporting systems and Exchange based systems. The Associate Principal Business Analyst contributes to the quality assurance process and is an active participant in software reviews and release testing to ensure the integrity of the FINRA processing environments.
Essential Job Functions:
Collaborates with senior analysts in collecting and drafting business requirements, technical specifications, user manuals and procedures, as well as technical notices to Members to address system related topics.
Networks with various business teams by participating in regular meetings with business sponsors such as Market Operations, Market Regulation and Office of General Counsel to ensure that the systems integrate seamlessly into the regulatory environments for both real-time and post market surveillance.
Assists senior analysts in identifying milestones, maintaining project plans, tracking user feedback, and maintaining backlog, using tools such as Miro, JIRA, Excel, and Power Point.
Provides Production Support by responding to client inquiries regarding data and system issues and escalating complex issues to senior business analysts.
Participates in requirements reviews with stakeholders to ensure that the requirements meet user expectations.
Assists in identifying and writing user stories and test scripts and participates in application testing.
Creates user documentation, training materials, and provides end user training
Education/Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Information Technology or related field and a minimum of four (4) years of related experience.
General understanding of fixed income and/or equity order management or trade reporting systems.
Working knowledge of application design and analysis.
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage changing priorities, within established guidelines and procedures.
Must have excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills.
Work Conditions:
Hybrid work environment with some travel/in-person presence required.
Extended hours, including occasional weekend testing may be required.
For work that is performed in CA, CO, New York, NY and WA, the chart below outlines the proposed salary range for the corresponding location. In addition to location, actual compensation is based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate’s skill set, level of experience, education, and internal peer compensation comparisons.
California: Minimum Salary $84,500, Maximum Salary $165,100
Colorado: Minimum Salary $76,800, Maximum Salary $137,500
New York, NY: Minimum Salary $92,200, Maximum Salary $165,100
Washington: Minimum Salary $76,800, Maximum Salary $158,200

Important Information
FINRA’s Code of Conduct imposes restrictions on employees’ investments and requires financial disclosures that are uniquely related to our role as a securities regulator. FINRA employees are required to disclose to FINRA all brokerage accounts that they maintain, and those in which they control trading or have a financial interest (including any trust account of which they are a trustee or beneficiary and all accounts of a spouse, domestic partner or minor child who lives with the employee) and to authorize their broker-dealers to provide FINRA with duplicate statements for all of those accounts. All of those accounts are subject to the Code’s investment and securities account restrictions, and new employees must comply with those investment restrictions—including disposing of any security issued by a company on FINRA’s Prohibited Company List or obtaining a written waiver from their Executive Vice President—by the date they begin employment with FINRA. Employees may only maintain securities accounts that must be disclosed to FINRA at one or more securities firms that provide an electronic feed (e-feed) of data to FINRA, and must move securities accounts from other securities firms to a firm that provides an e-feed within three months of beginning employment.

As standard practice, employees must also execute FINRA’s Employee Confidentiality and Invention Assignment Agreement without qualification or modification and comply with the company’s policy on nepotism.

As our Salesforce Business Systems Analyst, you will play a vital role on our team in designing, configuring, testing, and deploying a new case management system and CRM for our Federal Government customer. We are looking for an individual who makes the customer mission their priority in delivering modern, user-centric, and reliable software products to automate manual business processes and workflows. Be an active member of an Agile development team, participating in all Agile ceremonies, updating tasks in Jira/ADO, and continual improvement.
Troubleshoot issues in production and non-production.
Learn new technical skills to meet the needs of the project and our customers.
Estimate the work required for each user story, feature, and epic with story points that establish the product roadmap.
Continue to grow as a professional while gaining new technical skills and knowledge.

As a Sales Ops Analyst you will play a pivotal role in shaping our sales strategy by providing reporting and valuable insights on sales data and activities. You will directly support sales leadership while driving the development and implementation of our sales analytics and data strategy, while identifying trends and recommend solutions or processes to drive sales effectiveness.

Work on building and maintaining sales commission data, pipelines, and ad-hoc reporting

Explore product bundling and product suite optimization to maximize our existing offerings.

Serve as a liaison between our data needs and what is currently available, guiding data cleansing efforts when necessary.
Possess the ability to influence and persuade stakeholders with data-driven insights.

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline. Master's degree preferred.
2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst, with a focus on sales analytics.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, such as SQL, Python, R, or similar.

Introduction
As a Package Consultant at IBM, get ready to tackle numerous mission-critical company directives. Our team takes on the challenge of designing, developing and re-engineering highly complex application components and integrating software packages using various tools. You will use a mix of consultative skills, business knowledge, and technical expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into our clients' business environment and achieve business results.

Your Role and Responsibilities

The Solution Architect is responsible for providing overall solution, set the direction and guide the team of SMEs in implementing Oracle Fusion Financials. Review and provide feedback to designs, business processes and functional and technical specifications for required reports, extensions, conversions, interfaces, and workflows. Lead Configuring Oracle Fusion financial modules including general ledger, payables, receivables, project accounting, purchasing, and federal or public sector processes etc. Lead developing use cases, test scripts, and perform testing cycles such as regression testing, integration testing and support user acceptance testing. Support development and delivery of user training and other deployment activities in the using the Oracle Fusion Applications.

The ideal candidate will have expertise in design, architect and deliver Oracle Financials and Procurement Applications

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 10 years of experience implementing and delivering Oracle Financial Applications as solution architect, functional lead, SME, and business analyst
3 plus years of experience implementing Oracle Fusion Applications as the Solution Architect / functional Lead / SME

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience implementing Oracle federal financials.
Past experience supporting federal agencies.
Experience supporting retail/re-sale accounting and financial systems.

About Business Unit
IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM
In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?


About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Who We Are: ThinkTek is a fast-growing Certified SBA 8(a) and Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) company. We specialize in providing management and technology consulting services to support the business and technology modernization efforts of the Federal Government. Position Description: ThinkTek is seeking an Security Specialst with an active security clearance. This Industrial Security Oversight Specialist (ISOS) position supports DCSA’s risk-based industrial security oversight mission by providing impactful pre-Security Review research and analysis relevant to the National Industrial Security Program (NISP). Research sources vary, but are primarily limited to commercial and government databases, controlled unclassified information (CUI), and publicly available information (PAI). Currently, due to COVID-19 mitigation efforts initiated by DCSA, a hybrid work arrangement of telework and on-site support temporarily exists.

Key Responsibilities include:

Producing impactful research and analysis of potential risks to cleared defense contractors (CDC) and Department of Defense (DoD) programs.
Identifying and reporting potential vulnerabilities associated with the CDC.
Identifying and reporting possible OPSEC or other security issues associated with the CDC.
Identifying and reporting possible violations of 32 Code of Federal Regulation (CFR) National Industrial Security Program Operating Manual (NISPOM) Part 117 requirements.
Authoring professional work products and meeting established deadlines.
Working in a collaborative on-site work environment at DCSA or independently through customer approved telework.
Provide security oversight as the primary DoD security interface for cleared contractor facilities relative to the establishment and maintenance of a security program in compliance with the NISP.
Responsible for handling more difficult, complex, and challenging industrial security issues within the NAESOC area of responsibility.
Identify and conduct administrative inquiries of serious security violations.
The ability to set well-defined and realistic personal goals and display a high level of initiative, effort, and commitment towards completing assignments in a timely manner.
Facilitate integration of the counterintelligence (CI) methodology into administration of the NISP and provides CI information and guidance to internal and external stakeholders.

Qualifications & Clearance Requirements:

Bachelor's degree.
At least one (1) years of experience with National Industrial Security System (NISS), and the Defense Information System for Security - Joint Verification System (DISS-JVS)
Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
Knowledge of the principles of OPSEC and OSINT.
Familiarity with new CUI guidance and directives.
Ability to understand and apply the principles of research to analyze, evaluate, and interpret raw data collected from multiple sources.
Current Top-Secret (TS) security clearance verifiable through DISS-JVS, and prior to start date.

Preferred Skill Sets of Qualified Candidates:

At least five (3) years' relevant experience in business analysis, intelligence, counterintelligence or industrial security.
Familiarity with the NISP and 32 CFR NISPOM 117 requirements.
Comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Office software packages.

ThinkTek offers telework and other flexible work arrangements to the greatest extent possible.

Job Description: C2 Labs, Inc. is a leading technology consulting firm specializing in Salesforce solutions and digital transformation. We are seeking a highly skilled Salesforce Business Analyst IV to join our team and play a critical role in delivering successful Salesforce projects for our clients. As a Salesforce Business Analyst IV at C2 Labs, you will collaborate with clients and stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and translate them into scalable and effective Salesforce solutions.

Requirements:

Must be a U.S. Citizen

Must live fulltime in the U.S.

Must be willing and able to travel as needed

Must be able to pass criminal background check(s)

Must be able to pass drug screening(s) including potential random tests

Responsibilities:

Collaborate closely with clients and stakeholders to understand their business requirements and translate them into actionable Salesforce solutions.

Conduct in-depth business process analysis and document current state and future state processes, identifying gaps, inefficiencies, and opportunities for improvement.

Facilitate requirement gathering sessions, workshops, and interviews to elicit business needs and define clear and concise user stories and acceptance criteria.

Translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications, ensuring alignment with Salesforce best practices and industry standards.

Work closely with development teams to ensure the accurate translation of business requirements into technical design and development.

Perform system configuration, customization, and data modeling within the Salesforce platform to meet business needs.

Conduct thorough testing and quality assurance to ensure the accuracy, performance, and usability of Salesforce solutions.

Provide ongoing support and training to end-users, addressing questions, issues, and change requests related to Salesforce functionality.

Collaborate with project managers to track project progress, manage priorities, and communicate updates to clients and stakeholders.

Stay up-to-date with the latest Salesforce releases, features, and best practices, and proactively share knowledge and insights with the team.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).

Extensive experience (7+ years) as a Business Analyst, preferably with a focus on Salesforce implementations.

Salesforce Certified Administrator or Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator certification is required.

Strong understanding of Salesforce platform capabilities, including Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Community Cloud.

Proven experience in gathering and documenting business requirements, creating user stories, and defining acceptance criteria.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business needs into clear and actionable solutions.

Solid understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies and experience working in collaborative, cross-functional teams.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients, stakeholders, and technical teams.

Experience with Salesforce data modeling, process automation, and integration patterns.

Familiarity with Salesforce Lightning Experience and declarative configuration capabilities.

Proficiency in using Salesforce tools and applications, such as Salesforce Analytics, Reports, and Dashboards.

How to Apply: If you are an experienced Salesforce Business Analyst with a passion for translating business requirements into effective Salesforce solutions, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining our team at C2 Labs, Inc.

In this position, you will be working for an organization specializing in various financial solutions. As a Financial Analyst/Business Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge market risk platform applications that are instrumental in the effective management of interest rate risk. These applications consist of three key components: a front-end interface, a robust database, and a powerful reporting tool.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the effective operation and performance of the market risk platform applications.
Analyze and assess market risk data and contribute to risk management strategies.
Utilize strong SQL skills to extract and manipulate data within the applications.
Participate in the design and implementation of enhancements and improvements to the platform.
Provide insights and support to business users in managing interest rate risk for our capital markets.

Requirements:

5+ years experience as financial/business analyst
Familiarity with mortgage and risk management concepts.
Strong proficiency in SQL.
Knowledge of AWS Redshift and MicroStrategy is a significant advantage.
Effective communication and teamwork skills.

If you are a highly motivated and skilled Financial Analyst/Business Analyst looking to make an impact in the financial industry, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and be part of our mission to manage interest rate risk effectively for our capital market

Manager, Product Management, Authorizations

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.


We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.


Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you.


In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas:

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

Our team is transforming customer spend through technology, and you will play a critical role in that transformation. In your role, you will be responsible for:

Leading an engineering team focused on delivering a platform requiring the highest tiers of resilience and performance

Owning the developer experience, redefining what it means to build and release within our ecosystem

Building products that enable engineers to code better technology on our platform

We want you if you are:


Intellectually Curious.

You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.


Communicator & Influencer.

You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.


Do-er.

You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.


Passionate & Customer Focus.

You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.


Learner.

You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.


Team Player

You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 year of product management experience or at least 3 year of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Job Title: Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience
Job Description:
314 Main Street (21020), United States of America, Cambridge, Massachusetts

Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience

Capital One is a high-tech company, a scientific laboratory, and a nationally recognized brand all in one reaching tens of millions of consumers. We are a passionate and entrepreneurial team embracing bold ideas, fostering collaboration and delivering great experiences for our customers.

Machine learning is at the heart of our approach. Our teams provide millions of customers with individualized, real-time experiences, protection, and decisions driven by machine learning and advanced analytic capabilities. In order to further scale our efforts in this space, we are building a world class machine learning platform. This platform will enable our data scientists and machine learning engineers to take models from conception to production faster and safer than ever before. This work is core to Capital One’s mission, changing banking for good!


As a Manager, Product Manager on the Machine Learning Experience (MLX) Product team, you will be part of the Enterprise Model Platform (EMP) team to define, design, and deliver model and data monitoring tooling and corresponding user experiences for Capital One’s model developer and data science community. This team is focused on building centralized, managed capabilities that standardize monitoring for model inputs and outputs.

We are looking for someone with industry-leading machine learning skill sets and product acumen to improve the model monitoring experience for Capital One model developers and data scientists. This role represents the needs of the customer to inform our product roadmap, ensuring we deliver tools aligned with the intended business outcomes. You will be responsible for building the roadmap, determining product requirements, and partnering with tech teams to deliver machine learning tools. The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about technology and deeply empathizes with customer needs. They are comfortable in conversation with engineering teams as well as stakeholders ranging from data scientists to senior leaders.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop and communicate the product vision and strategy for key components of the platform.

Deeply understand the needs of model developers, data scientists, and machine learning engineers across Capital One.

Prioritize the Product Backlog to maximize business and customer outcomes.

Incorporate design thinking and analytics to inform product design.

Enable collaboration and ensure communication between teams.

Maintain a healthy backlog of work and play a critical role in many agile ceremonies.

Support the team with escalation and resolution of impediments.

Serve as the connection between customers, Capital One’s mission, and your team.


We want you if you are:

Passionate about building impactful products.

You enjoy putting yourself in the shoes of customers. Even better if you have experience doing this with internal customers.

You have expertise in, or are excited about, machine learning model development, data science, and ML Ops

You are a learner who is able to quickly get up to speed in a highly technical environment.

You are experienced working in an Agile environment.

You are a do-er who can also zoom out and think strategically.

You have excellent oral and written communication skills.

You are highly collaborative and have the ability to influence and lead.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of experience in product management or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

3+ years of experience in Agile product management

Peraton Overview
Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the can't be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.
Responsibilities

Peraton is currently hiring a Sr. Cyber Operations Analyst who will be responsible for integrating knowledge, information, and data from a variety of partners, to include the U.S. Intelligence Community (IC), State, local, tribal, and territorial (SLTT), the private sector, international partners, the U.S. critical infrastructure, and computer network defense communities.

You are local to the Arlington, VA area, however, this position will allow you the ability to telework 50% of the time. Must be able to work on-site as required based on business conditions/needs.

You will be part of a team that optimizes analytical activities and integrate them into Threat Hunting & CISA Operations, as well the broader cyber community.

Position Description:

Apply knowledge of data, information, processes, organizational interactions, skills, and analytical expertise, as well as systems, networks, and information exchange capabilities to accomplish mission needs.
Manage Requests for Information (RFI) that are requested from Analysts, scope then assigning RFI to vendors for their action. Review, consolidate and forward responses to the requested analyst.
Work with the Mission Team analysts in creating/updating Information Needs (IN).
Draft organizational documentation such as Concept of Operations, Standard Operating Procedures, Work Instructions, etc.
Identify opportunities to increase the efficacy of cyber incident report handling and workflows.
Document challenges, coordinates across teams to identify opportunities for process improvement, and recommend solutions to ensure incident reporting apparatus success.
Develop plans to limit, mitigate, or defend against coordinated, malicious cyber operations that pose a potential risk to critical infrastructure or national interests.
Assesses project issues and develops resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and agency's satisfaction goals and objectives.
Develops mechanisms for monitoring project progress and for intervention and problem solving with project managers, line managers, and analysts.
Establish measures of effectiveness for cyber plans and activities that examine current processes and prior cyber incidents for lessons learned and best practices.
Coordinate and facilitate internal and external partner engagements facilitating information exchange and responding to requests for information or assistance.

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 12 years' experience required.
Ability to create and implement strategies to acquire and operationalize cyber programs required.
Working knowledge of cyber operations theory, and tactics, techniques and procedures required.
Ability to identify, analyze, and resolve program support deficiencies required.
Proven ability to develop and recommend corrective actions.
Active Top Secret security clearance with eligibility to obtain SCI required. In addition, selected candidate will be required to obtain and maintain a favorably adjudicated DHS background investigation (EOD) for continued employment.



Target Salary Range

$112,000 - $179,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

Job Title: Manager, Product Management - Credit Risk Management
Job Description:
Center 2 (19050), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Manager, Product Management - Credit Risk Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you

This role will be part of the Risk Management Product organization, and its initial scope will be to build and scale a Credit Decision Simulator Platform to cultivate best practices in consumer credit opportunities and risk management. The initial application of this platform will be a teaching product that is targeted to the credit learning journey to hone Capital One’s industry-leading approach to credit and to create a more robust talent pool. Later applications will apply to the credit decision process itself.

This role will involve collaborating with a diverse team with expertise in engineering, data science, design, learning and development, economics, and credit. The product will be dynamic and interactive and will be built using standardized Capital One tools and technology frameworks, but will be generating new processes and standards as well. The MVP will be targeted to acquisition use cases, and later iterations will progressively expand to include other business areas, datasets, and so on.

In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 year of product management experience or at least 3 year of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Job Title: Operations Research Analyst / Data Scientist / Top Secret/SCI w/ Poly
Job Description:
Peraton Overview
Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the can't be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.
Responsibilities

Peraton is currently seeking to hire an experienced Operations Research Analyst / Data Scientist for the USCYBERCOM program.

Location: On-site at Fort Meade, MD.

In this role, you will:

Serve as Operations Research Analyst (Data Scientist).
Provide operations research analysis support for intelligence, cyberspace operations, contingency operations, and operational-level planning, joint and multilateral training exercises, and strategic engagement policy.
Research and collect information from various sources and analyze it for better understanding of cyberspace operations assessment frameworks and methodologies.
Interpret policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and objectives and apply operations research principles and techniques to compound analytic needs.
Apply data-mining techniques, statistical analysis, and build high-quality prediction systems. You will c onduct data mining using state-of-the-art methods.
Identify issues and priorities affecting assessment of planned or on-going cyberspace operations.
Select features, build and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques.
Enhance data collection procedures to include information relevant for building analytic systems.
Analyze, report, and develop recommendations on data related to compound operational metrics.
Assist in identifying and prioritizing requirements for capability development efforts.
Apply and/or develop highly advanced technologies, scientific principles, theories, and concepts to assist organizations in advancing performance and operating more efficiently.
Develop cost-benefit analysis, data collection, data analysis, risk analysis, simulation model execution, economic analysis, and operational effectiveness studies.
Assist in addressing requirements and the evaluation of data assessment strategies: sampling, statistical analysis, evaluation, flow processing, and management assessment strategies.
Develop concept papers, technical white papers, and related documentation detailing cyber security practices for implementation throughout DoD.
Possess an in-depth understanding of cyberspace doctrine, policies, operations, and organizations.
Collaborate with internal and external partners to facilitate cyberspace operations assessment situational awareness and information sharing.
Exhibit an intermediate degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness during the conducting of research and development and preparation of documents, briefings, and analyses which may include narrative, tabular, and graphic materials.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and presents results in a clear, understandable manner.

#COSS

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree in Operations Research, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Computer Engineering, or related discipline
5 years of data science ( and/or operations research analysis) related experience.
Demonstrated strengths: attention to detail, organizational, communications, analytical and problem-solving skills.
U.S. citizenship
Active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph.

Desired:

Proficiency in using query languages (e.g., SQL, Hive, Pig).
Experience with common data science toolkits (e.g., R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc.).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., D3.js, GGplot, etc.)
Ability to devise modeling and measuring techniques, and utilizes mathematics, statistical methods, engineering methods, operational mathematics techniques (linear programming, game theory, probability theory, symbolic language, etc.) and other principles and laws of scientific and economic disciplines to investigate complex issues, identify, and solve problems, and aid better decision making.
Target Salary Range

$112,000 - $179,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range

An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran.

Job Title: Senior Manager, Product Manager, Innovation Lab
Job Description:
Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Manager, Product Manager, Innovation Lab

Capital One is a high-tech company, a leading bank and credit card company, and a nationally recognized brand. We are a passionate and entrepreneurial team embracing bold ideas, fostering collaboration and delivering great experiences for our customers. The Lab is tasked with building next-generation products and services for Capital One and transforming how we get work done at the company. The Lab was the first place in the company to use cloud services, data science, hackathons, and design thinking – all practices that define work at the company today. This work is core to Capital One’s mission, changing banking for good!


As a Sr. Product Manager for The Lab, you will be sourcing new problems from our different lines of business, exploring novel technical implementations to solve those problems, working with designers and engineers to rapidly prototype, and then navigating a rich set of cross-functional teams in order to deploy solutions in-market. This team is focused on building novel and high-impact solutions that drive measurable business impact and deliver customer joy. We’re passionate about building software and solutions that are going to shape the direction of not just the company, but the industry.


The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about technology, has a track record of building things “zero to one”, and deeply empathizes with internal and external customer needs. They are comfortable in conversation with engineering teams, working with UX researchers on early explorations, designers on concrete user journeys and flows, as well as stakeholders ranging from data scientists to senior leaders.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Sitting with and observing senior leaders and individual contributors in different parts of the company to source new, important, unsolved problems.

Researching and staying up-to-date with current technologies that could impact our business or enable new solutions.

Formulating technically viable solutions to high-impact problems and aligning with design and engineering on concrete plans for delivery.

Mapping out risks and rigorously derisking plan execution to minimize time wastage.

Developing and communicating the product vision and strategy.

Incorporate design thinking and analytics to inform product design.

Enable collaboration and ensure communication between teams.

Support the team with escalation and resolution of impediments.

Serve as the connection between customers, Capital One’s mission, and your team.


You:

Are someone who can’t help but to build things, unasked for.

Are passionate about building impactful products.

Love keeping up with the latest technology and learning by working with it and improving it.

Have a track record of entrepreneurship.

Enjoy putting yourself in the shoes of customers. Even better if you have experience doing this with internal customers.

Are a do-er who can also zoom out and think strategically.

Have excellent oral and written communication skills.

Are highly collaborative and have the ability to influence and lead.

You enjoy programming with multiple different languages.

You have strong skills from outside of the financial industry.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 5 years of experience in product management or at least 5 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

Been on a founding team or in a startup environment.

Andworx is hiring a SharePoint Developer to play an important role in the development of mission and collaborative operational applications for our Federal Government customer. As SharePoint Developer, you will be working on an Agile team that develops custom SharePoint solutions. You will work with a team of SharePoint developers, testers, business analysts, and stakeholders to develop solutions to meet customer requirements and objectives. This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to a dynamic team where you will have high visibility developing SharePoint solutions that make an impact within an organization with a critical national security mission.

Please Note: This position may require on-site work at the customer's request. Candidates must be within a commutable distance to the Washington, DC Metro area.

Requirements

3-8 years full life cycle SharePoint experience include on-prem SharePoint 2016 and SharePoint O365.
Experience developing SharePoint solutions using JavaScript, Angular, HTML, CSS, and other development languages and frameworks.
Knowledge of current SharePoint/O365 services and standards including SharePoint Designer, web parts, workflows, and customizations.
Ability to develop solutions using SharePoint Online functionality (Hub Sites, Term Store, Enterprise Keywords, SPFx Deployment, Content Types, etc.).
Ability to develop SharePoint solutions that meet customer requirements.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with both technical and non-technical people.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field or equivalent years' experience.
U.S Citizenship is required as is ability to successfully obtain a Position of Trust clearance.

Preferred Qualifications

Microsoft SharePoint certifications.
Experience creating Microsoft Power Apps and Power Automate solutions.
Experience working in an Agile development environment.

Responsibilities

As SharePoint Developer, you will leverage a blend of technical skills, business analysis, organization, and communication, to perform the following:

Develop and support custom SharePoint and O365 solutions for our customer.
Support user requests for SharePoint services that include new team sites, pages, lists, document libraries, workflows, etc.
Create SharePoint technical guides, user guides, diagrams, and flow charts for developed solutions.
Anticipate, mitigate, identify, troubleshoot, and resolve SharePoint issues and escalating incidents as necessary on behalf of users.
Assist and support SharePoint developers and system administrators throughout project lifecycles.
